openstack%2Fneutron~stable%2Fliberty~I663f1264fb3963789b79a4a7c3e46d232b2f0620,openstack/neutron,stable/liberty,bug/1512450,I663f1264fb3963789b79a4a7c3e46d232b2f0620,Optimize and refactor router delete execution,MERGED,2016-01-29 12:50:51.000000000,2016-03-30 22:08:58.000000000,2016-03-30 22:08:57.000000000,43,9,0,274053,feaf9d33780b34e88e3c497f582a21fc97ffe2e6,76,19,5,3,19797,Hynek Mlnarik,hmlnarik,"Optimize and refactor router delete execution
This is a combination of 2 commits as per request from Ryan Moats.
Optimize router delete execution
Optimize the execution of router delete in the L3 agent
by not performing operations in the router namespace that
will be removed as the last step of the workflow.
Comparing the slopes of the least squares fit of delete
execution time shows that this optimization decreases that
slope by over half.
Conflicts:
(cherry picked from commit 526dac467ba869284dd096c7a9e8251fb1bd4e85)
Refactor router delete processing
The discussion in [2] indicated that [1] would lead to orphaned
items during error cases.  This refactoring replaces the
optimistic approach followed by [1] with a separate delete code
path that does not execute the operations that take place within
the namespace that will be removed.  Operations that take place
outside of those namespaces are still performed to ensure that
no orphaned items result.
A comment has been added to the functional test to explain what
case is being tested.
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/240971
[2] conversation starting at http://goo.gl/bZgvqW
Conflicts:
Closes-Bug: 1512450
Signed-off-by: Ryan Moats <rmoats@us.ibm.com>
(cherry picked from commit 300f73d489ce0131035bac59a1f12787e20bf3ab)

openstack%2Fkeystone~master~I3e5a41be91ebe87f33eab9e545f330dc141bb88e,openstack/keystone,master,bug/1557609,I3e5a41be91ebe87f33eab9e545f330dc141bb88e,Improve error message for schema validation,MERGED,2016-03-29 23:43:00.000000000,2016-03-30 22:06:18.000000000,2016-03-30 22:06:18.000000000,3,3,2,299036,815a9247758a79551cb106b09e2f5a7c1bd61cfc,11,3,1,1,8482,Colleen Murphy,krinkle,Improve error message for schema validation
Without this patch, users who enter long project names that fail the
jsonschema validation are faced with the message:
Invalid input for field 'name'. The value is '<very long name>'.
which simply echoes back the input value and does not provide
information about what was wrong with the input. This is less than
helpful. This patch modifies the validator error message to, in
addition to supplying the name of the failed resource, also provide the
error message directly from the jsonschema exception. In apparently all
cases this message includes the value the user entered, so we can omit
echoing the value back. An example of the new message is:
Invalid input for field 'name': u'<very long name>' is too long
An alternative to this patch would be to follow the pattern given by
the ""create_user"" action, where jsonschema does not validate the
maxLength and it is instead validated at the core level by a
keystone.common.clean function. This would solve bug 1557609 and give
us a more descriptive error message, but moves validation further down
the chain and contradicts bp api-validation.
Change-Id: I3e5a41be91ebe87f33eab9e545f330dc141bb88e
Closes-bug: #1557609

openstack%2Fdevstack-gate~master~Iea45f53b8c26985cb0da9720a631fcf8725522cf,openstack/devstack-gate,master,bug/1544827,Iea45f53b8c26985cb0da9720a631fcf8725522cf,Save PROJECTS form the job defintion for use in reproduce.sh,MERGED,2016-02-14 22:45:05.000000000,2016-03-30 22:05:28.000000000,2016-03-30 22:05:28.000000000,10,1,1,280027,f34dab53e79bdd703a03da84f5f5ebe56a741a24,15,5,3,2,12898,Tony Breeds,tonyb,Save PROJECTS form the job defintion for use in reproduce.sh
If the Jenkins Job definition adds items to the PROJECTS variable that
are not included as we build up PROJECTS reproduce.sh will ultimately
fail.
The fix saves the PROJECTS as it is passed into devstack-gate-wrap and
includes that in reproduce.sh.
Change-Id: Iea45f53b8c26985cb0da9720a631fcf8725522cf
Closes-Bug: bug/1544827

openstack%2Fsearchlight-ui~master~I07123ea439fa0643fa73297a98fc70316414ab0e,openstack/searchlight-ui,master,bp/horizon-initial-search-panel-plugin,I07123ea439fa0643fa73297a98fc70316414ab0e,Add getProject policy check to project name filter,MERGED,2016-03-30 01:03:31.000000000,2016-03-30 21:47:59.000000000,2016-03-30 21:47:59.000000000,56,20,0,299050,07fb0372ed1577cfdd68464bee2683ceeb54923a,11,3,2,1,7665,Travis Tripp,travis.tripp,Add getProject policy check to project name filter
The project column is enabled for admins by default, but can be enabled
via searchlight_policy.json for all users.  When it is enabled, it will
cause a lookup for the project name to be done based on the project id
of the resource in the results. However, the keystone get_project
api itself has a policy on it and any requests for a project name
will fail if the current user doesn't have access rights to it.
By default, non-admin users will get a forbidden result which causes
horizon to log the current user out (horizon bug).
This patch adds a policy check for 'identity', 'identity:get_project'
before attempting to look up the project name.
Implements-blueprint horizon-initial-search-panel-plugin
Change-Id: I07123ea439fa0643fa73297a98fc70316414ab0e

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible~liberty~Id8c6dcfa8b2b5bf4539f45470e634780ca59e725,openstack/openstack-ansible,liberty,liberty_upgrade,Id8c6dcfa8b2b5bf4539f45470e634780ca59e725,Fix typo in upgrade script,MERGED,2016-03-30 17:07:35.000000000,2016-03-30 21:46:26.000000000,2016-03-30 21:46:26.000000000,1,1,0,299541,1e8858f12d96c078a4526978af6e8f748f86d7a9,10,6,1,1,14805,Jimmy McCrory,jimmy-mccrory,Fix typo in upgrade script

openstack%2Fpython-openstackclient~master~Ib034fed15f11fc3e756985b3131a9922129ed6bf,openstack/python-openstackclient,master,bug/1563172,Ib034fed15f11fc3e756985b3131a9922129ed6bf,Aggregate object should be ""grouping of compute hosts""",MERGED,2016-03-29 04:08:47.000000000,2016-03-30 21:41:30.000000000,2016-03-30 21:41:30.000000000,2,2,0,298518,b2e47b62280a3e559207c3083d57d6a354f9c6a0,8,4,1,2,8276,kiwik,kiwik,"Aggregate object should be ""grouping of compute hosts""
The describe of Compute ""aggregate"" in command-objects and commands
documents use ""a grouping of servers"", but exactly that should be a
grouping of compute hosts. ""server"" object in OSC is a virtual machine
instance, and server group should be ""grouping of servers"".
Change-Id: Ib034fed15f11fc3e756985b3131a9922129ed6bf
Closes-Bug: #1563172
Related-Bug: #1542171

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible-os_glance~master~I02b69cf5985e8788513db58f7e8015f8135b9d58,openstack/openstack-ansible-os_glance,master,bug/1561947,I02b69cf5985e8788513db58f7e8015f8135b9d58,Adjust Glance/Swift backend configuration,MERGED,2016-03-30 10:13:08.000000000,2016-03-30 21:27:29.000000000,2016-03-30 21:27:29.000000000,16,6,0,299269,b3f12253754035671335aa4ea31ce00534a6de0f,14,4,4,4,6816,Jesse Pretorius,jesse-pretorius,Adjust Glance/Swift backend configuration
As per [1] The way of configuring a Swift back-end for Glance
has changed. This change has been done in such a way that when
using Keystone v3 for authentication, the current configuraiton
method breaks.
This patch adjusts the way the configuration is done in order
to achieve the same result as before - a single working Swift
backend for Glance if the deployment opts to use Swift as a
backend.
[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/glance/configuring.html#configuring-swift-configuration-file
Closes-Bug: #1561947

openstack%2Fmurano~stable%2Fmitaka~Ica8585b9750277d29f571b90dc7b92e12e5fef30,openstack/murano,stable/mitaka,bug/1562011,Ica8585b9750277d29f571b90dc7b92e12e5fef30,Handling of ephemeral methods was fixed,MERGED,2016-03-29 12:39:39.000000000,2016-03-30 21:22:41.000000000,2016-03-30 21:22:41.000000000,18,14,0,298711,008c299e68d78ee207d431ceeed70e98329888a5,10,4,1,3,7226,Stan Lagun,istalker2,Handling of ephemeral methods was fixed
Ephemeral method is the one that created
on the fly and doesn't belong to extension
class. Such methods were returned as a replacement
for ambiguous methods. Such ephemeral method
would throw exception upon attempt to invoke it so that
we get this exception on run-time rather that load-time.
However yaql FunctionDefinition code wasn't ready for
such functions
Change-Id: Ica8585b9750277d29f571b90dc7b92e12e5fef30
Closes-Bug: #1562011

openstack%2Fmurano~stable%2Fmitaka~Ib33e6d46178cd9da70f6f0535feb0bbd81179b4b,openstack/murano,stable/mitaka,,Ib33e6d46178cd9da70f6f0535feb0bbd81179b4b,Fix case-sensitive filter value in cfapi,MERGED,2016-03-30 14:15:15.000000000,2016-03-30 21:22:35.000000000,2016-03-30 21:22:35.000000000,1,1,0,299435,2c333c870e5047e19476e5f76496be911cadb4bc,13,5,1,1,20364,Konstantin Snihyr,ksnihyr,Fix case-sensitive filter value in cfapi
String values for filters in glare case-sensitive unlike murano db-api.
This patch for cfapi fix services retrieve from glare api.
Change-Id: Ib33e6d46178cd9da70f6f0535feb0bbd81179b4b

openstack%2Fmurano~stable%2Fmitaka~I440d2985f9122dad53c81b15148e60df4e7e9583,openstack/murano,stable/mitaka,bug/1548857,I440d2985f9122dad53c81b15148e60df4e7e9583,Do not upgrade packages with cloud-init,MERGED,2016-03-30 08:08:15.000000000,2016-03-30 21:22:24.000000000,2016-03-30 21:22:24.000000000,0,4,0,299186,a8a41a082462f99fde5d343dcf114fa7f5ca8c41,13,7,1,2,15168,Kirill Zaitsev,kzaitsev,Do not upgrade packages with cloud-init
This patch deletes 'package_upgrade: true' option from cloud-init confs.
It caused upgrading of all the packages in the images spawned by murano.
This made spawning VMs slow and in certain cases caused
dpkg locks be still in place when murano-agent attempted to
install packages
Change-Id: I440d2985f9122dad53c81b15148e60df4e7e9583
Closes-Bug: 1548857

openstack%2Fcharm-ceilometer~stable~I9ed88f17bf8659eeaeab4b86fea5c7710611a779,openstack/charm-ceilometer,stable,bug/1541618,I9ed88f17bf8659eeaeab4b86fea5c7710611a779,Use peer_retrieve to get secrets from other nodes.,MERGED,2016-03-14 23:10:59.000000000,2016-03-30 21:22:16.000000000,2016-03-30 21:22:16.000000000,9,6,0,292641,09100f95b6d9ad31818ca5bd536109b40bf966e0,34,3,5,2,8992,Billy Olsen,billy-olsen,Use peer_retrieve to get secrets from other nodes.
The secret sharing previously worked because it used the peer storage
prior to leadership election due to the direct usage of relation_get
rather than using the retrieval methods provided by the peer storage
framework.
Closes Bug: #1541618
(cherry picked from commit fafc1d4ff52eb04779f0109b8b096e8e84af7f23)
Change-Id: I9ed88f17bf8659eeaeab4b86fea5c7710611a779

openstack%2Fcharm-ceilometer~stable~I0431192e165353aa2fd414f06afaf6ce132f9970,openstack/charm-ceilometer,stable,charm-tools-updates,I0431192e165353aa2fd414f06afaf6ce132f9970,Update to charm-tools >= 2.0.0,MERGED,2016-03-30 20:00:00.000000000,2016-03-30 21:21:47.000000000,2016-03-30 21:21:47.000000000,3,2,0,299602,511f2e8eb86841950d0c4f29c5cea0158ae3f360,7,3,1,2,8992,Billy Olsen,billy-olsen,Update to charm-tools >= 2.0.0
The new release of charm-tools no longer ships the charm
command; update minimum version requirement and switch
to using charm-proof instead, unblocking current pep8
failures across all charms.
Also pin the version of requests to 2.6.0 until theblues
(indirect dependency of charm-tools) sort out its
requirements versioning.
Change-Id: I0431192e165353aa2fd414f06afaf6ce132f9970
(cherry picked from commit 0254587408524b9df76a51429420486ea0ab6bfe)

openstack%2Fneutron~stable%2Fmitaka~Iec7d3138aee3fc904312dbc45ef76854ad0ea789,openstack/neutron,stable/mitaka,bug/1557946,Iec7d3138aee3fc904312dbc45ef76854ad0ea789,conn_testers: Bump timeout for ICMPv6 echo tests,MERGED,2016-03-23 14:25:51.000000000,2016-03-30 21:10:26.000000000,2016-03-30 21:10:26.000000000,15,1,0,296479,4504a7431940443f036f9d1ab64e7255b2e11251,23,9,1,1,9656,Ihar Hrachyshka,ihrachys,conn_testers: Bump timeout for ICMPv6 echo tests
In IPv6 scenarios NDP can increase round-trip time of ICMPv6 packets over
1 seconds. The patch increases timeout for ICMPv6 to 2 seconds. Note
that this will extend scenarios when ping is supposed to fail.
Change-Id: Iec7d3138aee3fc904312dbc45ef76854ad0ea789
Closes-Bug: 1557946
(cherry picked from commit 420d5c7987f8ff7473d70697e5606f07ccfe7c1d)

openstack%2Ftripleo-common~master~I488a8c4194bcefff8d5116276ed704b4c2830a5e,openstack/tripleo-common,master,no_opm,I488a8c4194bcefff8d5116276ed704b4c2830a5e,tripleo.sh - build puppet modules from source for stable branches,ABANDONED,2016-03-04 18:25:34.000000000,2016-03-30 20:56:55.000000000,,23,20,2,288626,e972422b4fe62806d3c72b420a6bb71ad39ffd0a,8,4,1,1,4328,Steven Hardy,shardy,tripleo.sh - build puppet modules from source for stable branches
Currently we use OPM for testing stable branches, which isn't ideal because
we then can't test latest stable versions of the modules, e.g via use of
dependencies referenced in patch commit messages etc.
So, instead we always default to building modules from source, and add logic
to set the branches for modules where appropriate.  Note we can't do this via
a global reporef inside the puppet_modules element, because that element mixes
OpenStack and non-OpenStack modules, and the latter never have stable branches,
which we can't check without pulling every repo.
Also note that in CI the repos will already be pulled and set to the correct
commit, so we will respect the reporef's set by toci_instack in that case,
the logic to set branches here is really for developer convenience.
Change-Id: I488a8c4194bcefff8d5116276ed704b4c2830a5e

openstack%2Fproject-config~master~I50048b347693b6743849220458dab4756a4a1c71,openstack/project-config,master,,I50048b347693b6743849220458dab4756a4a1c71,Revert ""move fedora23 devstack to experimental""",MERGED,2016-03-29 04:30:00.000000000,2016-03-30 20:37:30.000000000,2016-03-30 20:37:30.000000000,1,1,0,298525,421c1ad662e052d6b1f0ba1b8f3a679a64cefa0c,9,5,1,1,7118,Ian Wienand,iwienand,"Revert ""move fedora23 devstack to experimental""
This reverts commit 2b2489966622939f17fe2250678abe9efac761eb.
The issue of not running on the right performance nodes was corrected
with I64cf074424b3c8eebf67510ba91bf24f2680dd0d.  I have done a number
of runs since then, all of which have landed on a RAX node
This low number is about what I would expect; it is about 5 minutes
more than other platforms running the same tests and is mostly taken
up by building pip wheels.
Note; we are considering a wheel builder for Fedora.  In terms of the
building, mirror and job setup, that's all quite straight forward.
The only problem might be with the infra puppet that sets up slave
nodes.  Fixing this for new releases is generally overall useful work;
it's not like the new stuff Fedora ships is going away (e.g. see
puppet4 efforts), but it can often be some effort to get this going.
This means we can not really rely on a pip mirror being up the same
day as we want to be testing devstack.
[1] http://logs.openstack.org/62/295062/1/experimental/gate-tempest-dsvm-platform-fedora23-nv/06bb66f/
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/62/295062/1/experimental/gate-tempest-dsvm-platform-fedora23-nv/1b21f93/
[3] http://logs.openstack.org/62/295062/1/experimental/gate-tempest-dsvm-platform-fedora23-nv/2941b3e/

openstack%2Ftrove~stable%2Fliberty~I8738d4dcac2cc37b727767ba614fab4339758e22,openstack/trove,stable/liberty,bug/1563028,I8738d4dcac2cc37b727767ba614fab4339758e22,Address change in Route v2.3,MERGED,2016-03-30 10:50:02.000000000,2016-03-30 20:05:10.000000000,2016-03-30 20:05:10.000000000,3,2,0,299287,a571e449178a5b3dbab75129c12175e3aaeb0a09,6,2,1,1,9664,amrith,amrith,Address change in Route v2.3
Routes v2.3 which just came out included a change (see the LP bug
referenced below) that caused py27 to fail.
At issue is that Routes<2.3 allowed both
submapper.connect(route_name, route_path), and
submapper.connect(route_path).
In 2.3, you were required to provide both route_name and
route_path. This change adds a route_name to support both Routes < 2.3
and Routes == 2.3.
Change-Id: I8738d4dcac2cc37b727767ba614fab4339758e22
Closes-Bug: 1563028
(cherry picked from commit 6664fb27af2218c411230f91b8e23e72845cbf2a)

openstack%2Fpython-manilaclient~master~I96d273071966d2dc63de40c6f1b777fbb34a50fa,openstack/python-manilaclient,master,bug/1559290,I96d273071966d2dc63de40c6f1b777fbb34a50fa,UnsupportedVersion Thrown for Supported Version,MERGED,2016-03-29 14:32:29.000000000,2016-03-30 19:56:18.000000000,2016-03-30 19:56:18.000000000,60,21,10,298780,8143f7aa1cb2f4494292d3b4781365c429f0fdb6,22,5,3,3,16212,Chuck Fouts,cFouts,UnsupportedVersion Thrown for Supported Version
If the maximum client version is higher than the maximum server version,
but the server version is otherwise valid, an UnsupportedVersion
exception is thrown. This bug fixes this issue by downgrading the
requested version, during API version discovery, from the maximum
client version to the maximum server version. The maximum server version
must be supported by the client. If all conditions are properly met the
client will continue to use the maximum server version for the remainder
of the request.
In order to log that the client version is being downgraded to match
the server version, when using the --debug flag, it was necessary to
update the logging configuration. Logging can now be used anywhere in
manilaclient as needed.
Change-Id: I96d273071966d2dc63de40c6f1b777fbb34a50fa
Closes-Bug: 1559290

openstack%2Fdesignate-dashboard~stable%2Fmitaka~Id5f0f0cb9cba455fededa622da04ed7bee313218,openstack/designate-dashboard,stable/mitaka,bug/1561202,Id5f0f0cb9cba455fededa622da04ed7bee313218,Add ADD_INSTALLED_APPS to 'enabled' file,MERGED,2016-03-26 16:33:49.000000000,2016-03-30 19:53:44.000000000,2016-03-30 19:53:44.000000000,2,0,1,297960,72d45d64cace23950ef32e670e074ab45ec4d25b,12,5,3,1,741,Kiall Mac Innes,kiall,Add ADD_INSTALLED_APPS to 'enabled' file

(cherry picked from commit 1ed7893eb2ae10172a2f664fc05428c28c29099e)
Change-Id: Id5f0f0cb9cba455fededa622da04ed7bee313218
Closes-Bug: #1561202

openstack%2Fheat~master~Id9c98ee87adf64f58ba25bb19269a38af71853d5,openstack/heat,master,bug/1488326,Id9c98ee87adf64f58ba25bb19269a38af71853d5,Make encryption script log exception and continue,MERGED,2016-03-21 21:13:12.000000000,2016-03-30 19:52:13.000000000,2016-03-28 16:00:27.000000000,149,62,18,295520,4307f8722c3961b01105c2deab29e198a13b7a1c,20,8,3,2,7253,Jason Dunsmore,jbd,Make encryption script log exception and continue
The heat-manage update_params encrypt script is meant to be used
as a tool for encrypting parameters in database entries for older
stacks. For encrypting the database, the service may be required
to be taken offline; thus the script should be as robust as
possible. In particular, if the db entry contains malformed data,
instead of crashing, the script will log the error and continue
processing of further entries.
Change-Id: Id9c98ee87adf64f58ba25bb19269a38af71853d5
Co-Authored-By: Pratik Mallya <pratik.mallya@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1488326

openstack%2Fpuppet-cinder~stable%2Fmitaka~Id16eadb5d71d1d313399e638be948d79190bde6a,openstack/puppet-cinder,stable/mitaka,osapi_max_limit,Id16eadb5d71d1d313399e638be948d79190bde6a,Add osapi_max_limit parameter,MERGED,2016-03-29 06:46:20.000000000,2016-03-30 19:33:50.000000000,2016-03-30 15:43:39.000000000,21,0,0,298556,564d8eb5ee224a4dcce3305abeaaf3d815de6f40,22,7,1,2,17505,Saverio Proto,zioproto,Add osapi_max_limit parameter
osapi_max_limit makes tunable the number of objects returned by
a single API call.
This is useful in large installations where tenants are likely
to have more than 1000 snapshots.
backup scripts that rely on:
existing_snapshots = cinder.volume_snapshots.list(search_opts=opts)
may have false negatives because the result is truncated to the
default value of 1000 items.
Change-Id: Id16eadb5d71d1d313399e638be948d79190bde6a
(cherry picked from commit 2e707d8ba12a7299f879b4f411bdcea5ae2e5d90)

openstack%2Ftrove~master~Ie1133e4c020106e8098685ba9125f84b356d8e0c,openstack/trove,master,1563038-master,Ie1133e4c020106e8098685ba9125f84b356d8e0c,Trove's tox tests should respect upper-constraints.txt,MERGED,2016-03-29 16:09:03.000000000,2016-03-30 19:28:11.000000000,2016-03-30 19:28:11.000000000,25,1,13,298850,aca90168f52169afb36500d6af77723b1a707008,29,8,6,1,9664,amrith,amrith,Trove's tox tests should respect upper-constraints.txt
This will force pip install to use the upper-constraints.txt specified
version of pip modules. When you don't do this, you are out on the
bleeding edge and become unstable everytime some python library in the
wide world changes in a way that you don't expect.
The releasenotes job has no constraints file, so override the install
command there.
Closes-Bug: #1563038

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible~liberty~Id90cfb9e94cea1ff2598bc71211efa7ef4370445,openstack/openstack-ansible,liberty,bug/1563024,Id90cfb9e94cea1ff2598bc71211efa7ef4370445,Upgrade RabbitMQ on OSA upgrade,MERGED,2016-03-29 16:56:30.000000000,2016-03-30 19:23:45.000000000,2016-03-30 19:23:45.000000000,13,4,0,298872,67938b57622e08e549eed5fe4b0a012ade65f33a,9,5,1,4,12892,Nolan Brubaker,nrb,Upgrade RabbitMQ on OSA upgrade
When upgrading OSA from an early Kilo release to 12.0.8, the RabbitMQ
version has likely changed and the 'Compare installed version of
RabbitMQ with new version variable' task will fail.
To avoid manual intervention in response to the failure, this change
introduces the RabbitMQ upgrade switch to both the run-upgrade.sh script and
the manual upgrade steps.
Change-Id: Id90cfb9e94cea1ff2598bc71211efa7ef4370445
Closes-Bug: #1563024

openstack%2Fcinder~master~I3ebb9979d37f62db161e2929fe2cff5a8ba2bf96,openstack/cinder,master,quota_utils_update_config_opt,I3ebb9979d37f62db161e2929fe2cff5a8ba2bf96,Update quota_utils with import for keystone_auth,MERGED,2016-03-02 00:29:30.000000000,2016-03-30 19:16:53.000000000,2016-03-07 18:14:15.000000000,2,1,3,286922,4d66d2e833b86156e49ee34da49f7d6040945af1,69,30,2,1,8912,Ryan McNair,rdmcnair,Update quota_utils with import for keystone_auth
Currently, keystone_auth config group is only getting defined in
the cinder-api service. In order to be able to use the quota_utils
helper from both the c-api and c-vol, we need to make sure that
the CONF.keystone_authtoken always gets imported. This is needed

openstack%2Ffreezer-web-ui~stable%2Fliberty~Ie941ff4d595a375e5fa808703b146e86d4d56e1f,openstack/freezer-web-ui,stable/liberty,bug/1555642,Ie941ff4d595a375e5fa808703b146e86d4d56e1f,Use correct parameter when handling exceptions,MERGED,2016-03-25 14:07:51.000000000,2016-03-30 19:13:40.000000000,2016-03-30 19:13:40.000000000,13,4,0,297693,844d586b698fd053472faf7b15e0fcc5271e3e9b,17,4,4,2,14340,Memo Garcia,memogarcia,Use correct parameter when handling exceptions

openstack%2Fnova~master~Id800e925fbb689d20e7907b698b67c92fd3da979,openstack/nova,master,bug/1276214,Id800e925fbb689d20e7907b698b67c92fd3da979,Live migration failure in API leaves VM in MIGRATING state,MERGED,2015-03-30 13:59:53.000000000,2016-03-30 19:10:29.000000000,2016-03-30 19:10:28.000000000,36,1,78,168916,f2a1f00829e849e78f850a73489864e57cbd86b3,433,47,35,2,12814,Bartosz Fic,bartosz-fic,Live migration failure in API leaves VM in MIGRATING state
When nova-api calls nova-conductor a RPC MessagingTimeout might
occur. In such case we shouldn't leave VM in MIGRATING state. Possible
scenarios are:
* nova-conductor received message but failed to respond, no additional
exceptions raised - live migration will start, VM will be moved to
destination host
* nova-conductor received message but failed to respond, additional
exception raised (e.g., LibvirtError) - LM will not start
* nova-api couldn't reach nova-conductor - LM will not start
Because we can't predict in API layer what happened below, this patch
writes instance fault to database when MessagingTimeout is caught.
Co-Authored-By: Pawel Koniszewski <pawel.koniszewski@intel.com>
Bartosz Fic <bartosz.fic@intel.com>
Closes-Bug: #1276214
Change-Id: Id800e925fbb689d20e7907b698b67c92fd3da979

openstack%2Fceilometer~master~If1f9f9fdbba1832e66d89d6b61f749790df5c2b6,openstack/ceilometer,master,bug/1553926,If1f9f9fdbba1832e66d89d6b61f749790df5c2b6,'ceilometer-polling' should fail with no valid pollsters,MERGED,2016-03-20 14:50:52.000000000,2016-03-30 19:10:19.000000000,2016-03-29 12:12:49.000000000,49,19,22,295011,bb6032fd1bdabf45035bdf36d3f8c08508088b96,41,7,8,3,9526,Zi Lian Ji,jizilian,'ceilometer-polling' should fail with no valid pollsters

openstack%2Fmanila~master~I9128ab086d63b72f33a6e879cb038a6759b56ef9,openstack/manila,master,bug/1496733,I9128ab086d63b72f33a6e879cb038a6759b56ef9,glusterManager instantiation regexp validation,MERGED,2016-02-23 20:20:16.000000000,2016-03-30 19:05:16.000000000,2016-03-07 17:46:15.000000000,131,19,27,283777,7f85400567809dbac3b62673c520e99253fb9de1,152,23,12,2,16629,Andrea Ma,ayma,glusterManager instantiation regexp validation
GlusterManager can be instantiated in two ways:
- with an address string like ""johndoe@example.com:/vol/dir""
- with a component dict like
{'user': 'johndoe',
'host': 'example.com',
'volume':'vol',
'path': 'dir'}
If the instance is created with an address string, it will be parsed
using regexp which facilitates the validation of the certain component
values.
Made changes such that if the GlusterManager is created using a
component dict, then change the format into the address string and allow
it to be parsed.
Mangling it through the parse ensures it meets the same criteria as
string addresses, without a partial reimplementation of parsing.
Closes-Bug: #1496733
Change-Id:I9128ab086d63b72f33a6e879cb038a6759b56ef9

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible~liberty~I675b702f796c91e612fea9b8dbc193f4412b2b1b,openstack/openstack-ansible,liberty,gate-optimise,I675b702f796c91e612fea9b8dbc193f4412b2b1b,[WIP] Updated repo_build for speed and notifications,ABANDONED,2016-03-23 14:47:52.000000000,2016-03-30 18:59:40.000000000,,281,126,0,296501,faf5e478328a649113a1892c7279bf4bdc82c06f,6,1,3,15,7353,Kevin Carter,cloudnull,[WIP] Updated repo_build for speed and notifications
The repo_build process is slow and can do with some improvement.
To achieve better speed of execution some several slow tasks,
as profiled by the integrated gate have been moved into executable
scripts using jobs. These scripts are generated from the playbooks
and the Jinja2 variables created during the repo_build run time and
make it possible to perform multiple actions in parallel. In test
the results were significantly faster[0].
A new library was created to identify risky packages we're installing.
Risky packages are ones that do not exists within the global constraints
file and do not have an upper boundary. These packages have a high
likelyhood to cause breakage in future releases and being able to indentify
potential sources of pain will improve the repo_build process and our
deployment capabilities.
[0] - http://paste.openstack.org/show/491537/
Depends-On: I675b702f796c91e612fea9b8dbc193f4412b2b1b
Change-Id: I675b702f796c91e612fea9b8dbc193f4412b2b1b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible~master~I36d55d9403d21f442351ec59ff2a173f0b037872,openstack/openstack-ansible,master,gate-optimise,I36d55d9403d21f442351ec59ff2a173f0b037872,[WIP] Gate: Set pip index and extra-index to OpenStack-CI repositories,ABANDONED,2016-01-11 15:02:12.000000000,2016-03-30 18:53:10.000000000,,32,6,0,265867,8c2812401ae1d895635c474a2abc6eae2c42e5de,64,6,17,2,6816,Jesse Pretorius,jesse-pretorius,[WIP] Gate: Set pip index and extra-index to OpenStack-CI repositories
This patch sets the gate checks to make use of the OpenStack-CI pypi
mirrors and wheel mirror that are available. This hopes to reduce lag
when retrieving packages from pypi/rpc-repo and also to reduce failures
due to external communication failures.

openstack%2Fdevstack~master~I8ab03af9d2f4974f26a7f8487ec978caea957e45,openstack/devstack,master,nova-online,I8ab03af9d2f4974f26a7f8487ec978caea957e45,Run online_data_migrations during nova setup,MERGED,2016-03-28 18:04:52.000000000,2016-03-30 18:51:21.000000000,2016-03-30 18:51:21.000000000,4,0,2,298356,bb49d35739b6375202a4ff23d49fdced6693472c,19,10,2,1,4393,Dan Smith,danms,Run online_data_migrations during nova setup
This is a normal step in the process for upgrade and is now
required for migration of flavors from the main DB to the API DB.
Since we previously made a bad decision to encode those flavors into
the first database migration, that means that even on new installs we
need to run these.
Deployment tools are going to be running this command any time they
do anything to the database post-deployment, which means adding this
to devstack is putting it in line with what normal deployments will
be doing.
Change-Id: I8ab03af9d2f4974f26a7f8487ec978caea957e45
Routes v2.3 which just came out included a change (see the LP bug
referenced below) that caused py27 to fail.
At issue is that Routes<2.3 allowed both
submapper.connect(route_name, route_path), and
submapper.connect(route_path).
In 2.3, you were required to provide both route_name and
route_path. This change adds a route_name to support both Routes < 2.3
and Routes == 2.3.
Related-Bug: 1563028
(cherry picked from commit 6664fb27af2218c411230f91b8e23e72845cbf2a)

openstack%2Fproject-config~master~I5ed473d14567cdf9fcaaa7e900e00efe665d91b8,openstack/project-config,master,,I5ed473d14567cdf9fcaaa7e900e00efe665d91b8,Set devstack-trusty(-2-node) to min-ready -1,MERGED,2016-03-30 17:56:44.000000000,2016-03-30 18:43:03.000000000,2016-03-30 18:43:03.000000000,2,2,0,299559,17a63888ef09be2d128fb015cee4c00a1528fbf6,7,3,1,1,4162,Paul Belanger,pabelanger,Set devstack-trusty(-2-node) to min-ready -1

openstack%2Ffuel-library~master~I017965929e95482b52b1dd457f211b18c3f01721,openstack/fuel-library,master,bug/1536836,I017965929e95482b52b1dd457f211b18c3f01721,Add support for auto libvirt type detection,ABANDONED,2016-02-03 23:51:36.000000000,2016-03-30 18:41:30.000000000,,52,3,18,275983,048fba53716e7c54a40e38b3b3d8aac31e6d9897,44,19,2,5,14985,Alex Schultz,mwhahaha,Add support for auto libvirt type detection
This change adds a fact called virtualization_support which checks for
the virtualization flags in the cpu info (vmx|svm) and sets the fact to
'true' or 'false' depending on the cpu flags existance.  libvirt_type is
set to 'auto' in hiera, we will use the fact to determine if we should
use kvm or qemu. This change still allows a user to specify a specific
libvirt_type to bypass this auto detection.
Related-Bug: #1536836

openstack%2Ffuel-library~master~I1506e0a2e01dde3556777011a72967b698955d99,openstack/fuel-library,master,bug/1525214,I1506e0a2e01dde3556777011a72967b698955d99,Reduce database idle timeout to 300 seconds,ABANDONED,2015-12-22 23:44:01.000000000,2016-03-30 18:41:00.000000000,,277,144,0,260751,1332e82ecdc250a1e3af3bcbe671a4f60eae47a1,89,6,7,23,14985,Alex Schultz,mwhahaha,Reduce database idle timeout to 300 seconds
This change standardizes the way we define the database idle timeout,
max pool size, max overflow and max retry settings. With this change we
are now setting the idle timeout to 300 seconds from 3600 seconds to
help reduce failures when failovers occur. With the smaller timeout,
there should be less idle connections that would be affected when a
database server goes away.
With this change, we are also allowing for the 4 database options to be
overriden using the hiera data for the respective services.  For
example, you could tune keystone with a higher (or lower) timeout then
the other serivces by defining database_idle_timeout in the keystone
hiera hash.  The following keys can be used in the respective service
hashs to override the settings:
database_max_pool_size
database_max_overflow
database_max_retires
database_idle_timeout
Closes-Bug: #1525214

openstack%2Ftrove~stable%2Fkilo~I8738d4dcac2cc37b727767ba614fab4339758e22,openstack/trove,stable/kilo,bug/1563028,I8738d4dcac2cc37b727767ba614fab4339758e22,Address change in Route v2.3,ABANDONED,2016-03-30 10:50:37.000000000,2016-03-30 18:28:49.000000000,,3,2,0,299288,104dd51d60492a3e76140a0636c80fe42696a9fe,4,2,1,1,9664,amrith,amrith,Address change in Route v2.3
Routes v2.3 which just came out included a change (see the LP bug
referenced below) that caused py27 to fail.
At issue is that Routes<2.3 allowed both
submapper.connect(route_name, route_path), and
submapper.connect(route_path).
In 2.3, you were required to provide both route_name and
route_path. This change adds a route_name to support both Routes < 2.3
and Routes == 2.3.
Change-Id: I8738d4dcac2cc37b727767ba614fab4339758e22
Closes-Bug: 1563028
(cherry picked from commit 6664fb27af2218c411230f91b8e23e72845cbf2a)

openstack%2Fpython-glanceclient~master~I0db0fd7ab07a0d61082b86829a671d8dbc0f2963,openstack/python-glanceclient,master,bug/1551076,I0db0fd7ab07a0d61082b86829a671d8dbc0f2963,Fix missing of debug info after we use session,MERGED,2016-02-29 05:07:29.000000000,2016-03-30 17:54:15.000000000,2016-03-30 17:54:15.000000000,21,0,8,285889,87c8c933bd9b79a2cf06f9f0bc02160b21e8920d,63,10,12,2,20105,Cao ShuFeng,caosf.fnst,Fix missing of debug info after we use session
After the introduce of this patch set[1], cli user can't get debug
info even --debug is passed. With the patch set[1], the request
action will be performed in keystoneclient.session.Session.
However the default log level of keystoneclient module is WARNING,
so user can't get debug info from keystoneclient.session.Session.
This change set the root log level to DEBUG when --debug is
passed.
[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/262220/
Change-Id: I0db0fd7ab07a0d61082b86829a671d8dbc0f2963
Closes-bug: 1551076

openstack%2Finstack-undercloud~master~I8ae85083b18e12d5bfedb63bfbd5f1c0eae2d2a6,openstack/instack-undercloud,master,puppet-aodh,I8ae85083b18e12d5bfedb63bfbd5f1c0eae2d2a6,Deploy Aodh services, replacing Ceilometer Alarm",MERGED,2015-11-03 23:59:52.000000000,2016-03-30 17:46:30.000000000,2016-01-05 23:32:46.000000000,51,0,3,241412,3102263862c402ef5d57b82a462685cb27d45f97,76,7,14,5,3153,Emilien Macchi,emilienm,"Deploy Aodh services, replacing Ceilometer Alarm

openstack%2Fnova-powervm~stable%2Fmitaka~I723045ea12868460d18cd79c16588b07fcc5368a,openstack/nova-powervm,stable/mitaka,,I723045ea12868460d18cd79c16588b07fcc5368a,Enable simplified remote restart by default for the vm,MERGED,2016-03-30 16:17:09.000000000,2016-03-30 17:32:11.000000000,2016-03-30 17:32:11.000000000,12,7,0,299515,c55b6ecc97895936b0bc9ff7f3a32342b4d65b90,7,3,1,2,13537,Lauren Taylor,lmtaylor,Enable simplified remote restart by default for the vm
The PowerVM platform by default supports Simplified Remote Restart
of VM. The change here ensures that during VM creation the remote
restart capability is turned on, if the caller wants it to be
turned off the capability needs to be explicitly passed in as
false.
Closes-Bug: #1561128
(cherry picked from commit 0b9cb2bd54fb3370ced940591d58eec9d135da71)

openstack%2Ftripleo-heat-templates~stable%2Fmitaka~I31c2d97d68c97b435f63863fae2c89f18f99681d,openstack/tripleo-heat-templates,stable/mitaka,upgrade-identifier,I31c2d97d68c97b435f63863fae2c89f18f99681d,Set UpdateIdentifier for upgrade converge, to prevent services down",MERGED,2016-03-29 11:47:01.000000000,2016-03-30 17:20:38.000000000,2016-03-30 17:20:38.000000000,4,6,0,298684,545a2ff2004ce0fb6b7708d0553eff8fa4596aac,12,3,1,2,7144,James Slagle,slagle,"Set UpdateIdentifier for upgrade converge, to prevent services down
We'd like to let the post puppet pacemaker controller services
restart to happen for the convergence step so set the
UpdateIdentifier. However also set the PackageUpdate to noop so the
yum_update.sh doesn't happen.
Since a full haproxy restart is expected, we no longer need the
systemctl reload added at Iae3bad745ecdf952a7a0314fe1375d07eb47c454
so remove that too.
Some more context at
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1321036
Co-Authored-By: marios <marios@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I31c2d97d68c97b435f63863fae2c89f18f99681d
(cherry picked from commit 6e56f873148784ff34babf62a8ccc718e7d789d3)

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server~master~Ia65da05a5c967965143e8167657688d6906ad1f0,openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server,master,conf-file-clustering,Ia65da05a5c967965143e8167657688d6906ad1f0,Remove clustering config from rabbitmq.config,MERGED,2016-03-29 11:09:37.000000000,2016-03-30 17:07:26.000000000,2016-03-30 17:07:26.000000000,1,7,0,298665,cadd8ff63548bf3d054de9c4638052630e631922,13,4,2,2,7219,git-harry,git-harry,Remove clustering config from rabbitmq.config
Remove cluster formation configuration from rabbitmq.config. Cluster
formation is managed by the task files in the role, see
tasks/rabbitmq_cluster.yml for details. The entries in the config
template are unnecessary and I believe they may be causing clustering
failures when the clustering tasks run.
Remove testing for cluster configuration in rabbitmq.config.

openstack%2Fpython-openstackclient~master~Ifd57bdf058efaeaa6cb43a7d4a60ee61ddb8de14,openstack/python-openstackclient,master,,Ifd57bdf058efaeaa6cb43a7d4a60ee61ddb8de14,Wrong param type in compute-service.rst,MERGED,2016-03-30 07:56:46.000000000,2016-03-30 16:55:49.000000000,2016-03-30 16:55:48.000000000,7,7,2,299183,63c57eb56eb7767086f586d5251a788dd150e113,11,6,2,2,16308,Sheel Rana,sheel.rana,Wrong param type in compute-service.rst

optional parameters
1. --long
2. --service <service>

openstack%2Fnetworking-generic-switch~master~I6169ddc9cfbc5f1844cbff335b965b9f6cfd8b4b,openstack/networking-generic-switch,master,bug/1562960,I6169ddc9cfbc5f1844cbff335b965b9f6cfd8b4b,Implement devices as stevedore plugins,MERGED,2016-03-14 19:26:13.000000000,2016-03-30 16:45:56.000000000,2016-03-30 16:45:56.000000000,523,382,12,292559,f41db62fb23ea520aa2998fe8ecec4235b22144d,59,5,15,20,9542,Pavlo Shchelokovskyy,pshchelo,Implement devices as stevedore plugins
This introduces a generic framework for devices that can be
managed by Generic Switch Mechanism driver.
New device driver plugins must be registered as `generic_switch.devices`
entrypoints, with stevedore driver name coinsiding with `device_type`
option in device config file.
Netmiko-based drivers are registered under `netmiko_<netmiko_type>`
names, where `netmiko_type` must be one of supported Netmiko platforms
(thus `device_type` in config file must also be set with `netmiko_` prefix).
Change-Id: I6169ddc9cfbc5f1844cbff335b965b9f6cfd8b4b

openstack%2Fastara-appliance~stable%2Fmitaka~Ieac128e47a44dd48acd00f68cd8e3a9ca15441ec,openstack/astara-appliance,stable/mitaka,bug/1558577,Ieac128e47a44dd48acd00f68cd8e3a9ca15441ec,Fix permissions on /etc/nginx/sites-enabled,MERGED,2016-03-29 16:15:09.000000000,2016-03-30 16:24:12.000000000,2016-03-30 16:24:12.000000000,5,1,0,298854,cd26f8925cdc178096bd298db654e5d66312c4b9,9,3,2,3,1420,Adam Gandelman,gandelman-a,Fix permissions on /etc/nginx/sites-enabled
With the switch to rootwrap, the API service now runs as the gunicorn
user but /etc/nginx/sites-enabled is still owned by root.  This updates
the DIB element to ensure its writable by gunicorn for config rendering.
Also makes a trivial update to releasenotes to remove the UNRELEASED
flag from mitaka.
Change-Id: Ieac128e47a44dd48acd00f68cd8e3a9ca15441ec
Closes-bug: #1558577
(cherry picked from commit effbf9e95004e67eec3ea49bc8f6c83b0a9d2fc9)
Routes v2.3 which just came out included a change (see the LP bug
referenced below) that caused py27 to fail.
At issue is that Routes<2.3 allowed both
submapper.connect(route_name, route_path), and
submapper.connect(route_path).
In 2.3, you were required to provide both route_name and
route_path. This change adds a route_name to support both Routes < 2.3
and Routes == 2.3.
Change-Id: I8738d4dcac2cc37b727767ba614fab4339758e22
Closes-Bug: 1563028

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible~master~I368adf5a19ba865e4e21bc8bcde096018bed8389,openstack/openstack-ansible,master,bug/1552362,I368adf5a19ba865e4e21bc8bcde096018bed8389,Add haproxy-install to setup-infrastructure.yml,MERGED,2016-03-02 21:52:02.000000000,2016-03-30 16:09:02.000000000,2016-03-03 20:08:27.000000000,5,0,0,287468,f5333abb988867f271224bbf938f3cf201f711f0,22,6,2,2,17275,Nate Potter,npotter,Add haproxy-install to setup-infrastructure.yml
Right now users who are using haproxy rather than a physical
load balancer need to run the haproxy-install.yml playbook,
but it is not included in setup-everything. It is not very clearly
documented that running this seperate playbook is necessary, since
the haproxy configuration is listed as (optional) in the installation
guide. Also, if the user has aphysical load balancer they will not
configure haproxy_hosts in /etc/openstack_deploy, so this playbook
will be skipped anyways.
Change-Id: I368adf5a19ba865e4e21bc8bcde096018bed8389
Partial-bug: #1552362

openstack%2Fneutron~master~I654e4d2496e19c011653eedb87c9b6026f801e9f,openstack/neutron,master,bp/bgp-dynamic-routing,I654e4d2496e19c011653eedb87c9b6026f801e9f,Queries for DVR-aware floating IP next-hop lookups,MERGED,2016-01-21 18:40:27.000000000,2016-03-30 16:07:19.000000000,2016-03-09 23:55:12.000000000,315,4,46,270971,2e11d85d6b3be3cf3be0dc988e0dfeb004ebce18,175,20,17,3,4187,Ryan Tidwell,ryan-tidwell,Queries for DVR-aware floating IP next-hop lookups
Introduce calls to collect host routes for floating IP's in a
DVR-aware way.  When a floating IP is associated through a
distributed router, the next-hop for the floating IP is announced
as the floating IP agent gateway port on the corresponding host.
Change-Id: I654e4d2496e19c011653eedb87c9b6026f801e9f
Implements: blueprint bgp-dynamic-routing
DocImpact: Neutron BGP should have docs created for the feature

openstack%2Fopenstacksdk~master~I634ac93b913e4fe9a3a812b384c8539d9266f2c0,openstack/openstacksdk,master,new_resource,I634ac93b913e4fe9a3a812b384c8539d9266f2c0,Refactor Resource to better serve Proxy,MERGED,2016-03-08 16:12:43.000000000,2016-03-30 15:44:42.000000000,2016-03-30 15:44:42.000000000,2091,2,21,289998,59e476e6b52827b4cc395d588dcacb416acc5490,35,3,6,3,8257,Brian Curtin,briancurtin,Refactor Resource to better serve Proxy
Through a series of attempts we haven't been able to sufficiently
solve the issue of what were called ""path_args"" in the past,
somewhat of a relic of the time before we had the Proxy layer.
path_args"" made a lot of sense back when there was only the
Resource layer, when the SDK's usage was almost entirely through
the classmethods on Resource, back when command-line example
scripts were all we had to go on.
As things have grown in the year-plus since that time, we have
bolted a great higher-level interface on a lower-level interface
that was stuck in an older use-case. It was most recently a problem
when we had resource.prop types that accepeted Resource types,
which both there and elsewhere meant it became significantly harder -
if not impossible - to have nested Resources. An example of this is
how ServerInterface is a Resource that depends on Server.
This new approach strips Resource down to a public API of only create,
get, update, delete, head, find, and list methods. Resource subclasses
are still constructed in the same manner, though the naming of what
were ""props"" is now slightly different, but more clear. Additionally,
through that change comes a more clear user experience for URI
parameters, formerly known as, ""path_args"". The changes here pave the
way for more clarity on query parameters, although they haven't been
fully explored.
As the changing of this class has pretty far reaching effects, it will
exist temporarily in the ""resource2"" module. The first change will be
to introduce the module itself as a standalone, and then we will change
each service independent of the others. Subsequent changes should not
be too disruptive, mostly in the form of renaming things like
resource.prop to resource.Body, and the like.
There is a fairly major side effect of the implementation of this class
that is behaviorally different from the initial Resource
implementation. Previously, any-and-all data sent into a Resource
initializer would be tracked internally on the Resource instance and
then sent to the server *even if it did not correspond to a
resource.prop on the class*. Ultimately this would have become a
problem as servers are becoming more strict about what they receive,
but this implementation makes no allowance for so-called loose data
to be entered. If there is no component attribute for an argument
to be sent to the server, or one received from the server, it will
not exist as an attribute of the Resource. Currently, said data is
just dropped entirely, but it could be logged or perhaps a
strict/loose mode could be engaged to warn or otherwise fail when
unexpected data is entered. Ultimately, this behavior had to happen.
In the near term it may mean that the SDK doesn't work exactly as it
had in previous versions, but that will just mean updating Resource
definitions to match what is truly expected or given by the server.
A relatively major change that comes from this refactoring is a
deconstruction of the unit tests that previously existed.
While resource.prop now lives on as resource2._BaseComponent,
the unit tests were started over from scratch as they were too
tightly coupled to the Resource class rather than being tested as
an independent unit. All of the code that is being refactored
as a part of this change is now being tested as independent of
any other code as is possible.
Additional changes:
1. Removed support for aliases in _BaseComponent.
Aliased property names were added for samples coming out of the
telemetry service as they used to be supported and documented having
multiple names. However, they are no longer documented this way.
Additionally, aliases are abused in object_store due to a
misunderstanding which causes actual breakage during use. One
resource.prop was in some cases serving to retreieve both header
and body values with similar names. Ultimately, aliases for
property names are not needed and their support is removed
as we have separated out the storage of body and header components.
2. Query parameters are now more officially and easily supported through
the _query_mapping attribute on Resource2. The resource2.QueryParameters
class creates the appropriate mapping of client-side names to
server-side names, which is then used when calling Resource2.list in
order to transpose the names and make a proper request.
3. As all tests were rewritten from scratch, tests for the wait_for*
functions end up being 8-10 times faster as they mock out time.sleep
rather than actually waiting, thus making test runs a lot quicker.
Change-Id: I634ac93b913e4fe9a3a812b384c8539d9266f2c0

openstack%2Fnova-powervm~master~I723045ea12868460d18cd79c16588b07fcc5368a,openstack/nova-powervm,master,bug/1561128,I723045ea12868460d18cd79c16588b07fcc5368a,Enable simplified remote restart by default for the vm,MERGED,2016-03-28 10:44:55.000000000,2016-03-30 15:42:16.000000000,2016-03-30 15:42:16.000000000,12,7,3,298194,0b9cb2bd54fb3370ced940591d58eec9d135da71,22,5,4,2,10207,Manas Mandlekar,manasmandlekar,Enable simplified remote restart by default for the vm

openstack%2Fproject-config~master~I265026ff146bd0a16b3aae5361124c5ce147d9c6,openstack/project-config,master,libvirt-test-job,I265026ff146bd0a16b3aae5361124c5ce147d9c6,fix testing job ""tempest-dsvm-nova-libvirt-kvm-apr""",MERGED,2016-03-30 14:44:02.000000000,2016-03-30 15:31:47.000000000,2016-03-30 15:31:47.000000000,1,1,0,299447,776a7f62bb1a396252361b5fb853c2df5c5dabbb,8,3,1,1,11303,Markus Zoeller (markus_z),mzoeller,"fix testing job ""tempest-dsvm-nova-libvirt-kvm-apr""
It looks like I missconfigured the new test job in commit f90d35885e
The following error occured:
The /opt/stack/new/apr project was not found;
if this is a gate job, add the project to the
$PROJECTS variable in the job definition.
die 534 'Cloning not allowed in this configuration'
Apparently the correct structure is:
export PROJECTS=""openstack/$project-name $PROJECTS""
export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG=""enable_plugin $project-name $repo-URL
This patch changes this accordingly.
Change-Id: I265026ff146bd0a16b3aae5361124c5ce147d9c6

openstack%2Fneutron~master~I32b8d3e85a8e12fc146c419766596fcfb61f32f6,openstack/neutron,master,fix-fip-for-allowed-addres-pair,I32b8d3e85a8e12fc146c419766596fcfb61f32f6,DVR: Handle unbound allowed_address_pair port with FIP,MERGED,2015-12-07 23:15:20.000000000,2016-03-30 15:31:13.000000000,2016-03-21 23:06:37.000000000,402,10,92,254439,6185a09d130edb7a21e21a354b3fa12fcbebe8a6,476,27,35,4,7016,Swaminathan Vasudevan,souminathan,DVR: Handle unbound allowed_address_pair port with FIP
If an allowed_address_pair port associated with a FloatingIP
is configured to a service_port, the allowed_address_pair port
should inherit the service_ports host binding and device
owner if device_owner is not configured.
Hence the DVR will be able to deploy the FloatingIP for
the provided allowed_address_pair.
In this case if the associated port's admin state changes,
the allowed_address_pairs device_owner and host binding will
be reverted back to None.
When associated service port is deleted the allowed_address_
pairs device_owner and host binding will be reverted as well.
Change-Id: I32b8d3e85a8e12fc146c419766596fcfb61f32f6
Closes-Bug: #1445255

openstack%2Fcinder~master~I1230715663ea00c3eb4241154e6f194dee0e23d4,openstack/cinder,master,bug/1554045,I1230715663ea00c3eb4241154e6f194dee0e23d4,Fix failure with rbd on slow ceph clusters,MERGED,2016-03-07 10:37:49.000000000,2016-03-30 15:27:53.000000000,2016-03-09 17:11:12.000000000,5,1,11,289252,66bd2b39d7490facc55dee3cab9523e8608fe491,143,42,11,2,8151,Michal Jura,mjura,Fix failure with rbd on slow ceph clusters
Make rados connection interval and retries configurable
for _try_remove_volume() function
Otherwise on slow ceph clusters, we can get following problem:
ImageBusy error raised while deleting rbd volume. This may have been
caused by a connection from a client that has crashed and, if so,
may be resolved by retrying the delete after 30 seconds has elapsed.""
Change-Id: I1230715663ea00c3eb4241154e6f194dee0e23d4
Co-Authored-By: Dirk Mueller <dirk@dmllr.de>
Closes-Bug: #1554045

openstack%2Ftrove~stable%2Fkilo~Ie1133e4c020106e8098685ba9125f84b356d8e0c,openstack/trove,stable/kilo,,Ie1133e4c020106e8098685ba9125f84b356d8e0c,Trove's tox tests should respect upper-constraints.txt,ABANDONED,2016-03-30 11:11:12.000000000,2016-03-30 15:27:46.000000000,,8,1,0,299302,d82a3a24977ca9faf14bdbece10061de4ccb8cd7,3,1,1,1,9664,amrith,amrith,Trove's tox tests should respect upper-constraints.txt
This will force pip install to use the upper-constraints.txt specified
version of pip modules. When you don't do this, you are out on the
bleeding edge and become unstable everytime some python library in the
wide world changes in a way that you don't expect.
The releasenotes job has no constraints file, so override the install
command there.
This commit is being proposed on stable/kilo and therefore the
install command includes the clear designation of the branch. This is
because, on branches other than master, we need to be sure to get the
upper-constraints.txt file for that branch.
Conflicts:
Closes-Bug: #1563038
(cherry picked from commit 8c29292d21f60f97bcfa2ba276d0e61124d0b6dc)

openstack%2Fpython-cinderclient~master~I416b63758373dc8ad29818d6952d1e9dd58d05f2,openstack/python-cinderclient,master,bug/1560862,I416b63758373dc8ad29818d6952d1e9dd58d05f2,Fix wrong request url when retrieving multiple request,MERGED,2016-03-23 08:54:55.000000000,2016-03-30 15:02:36.000000000,2016-03-29 10:31:08.000000000,3,2,2,296266,8bc5a446f09b7051afd233c7498da26cce9c2d83,25,14,7,1,19954,zwei,zwei,Fix wrong request url when retrieving multiple request
When the length of resource list is larger than osapi_max_limit.
Cinder will return a ""maker url"" which marks index of resources
already returned to client.
_cs_request() function fo HTTPClient will link the endpoint url of cinder
and this ""marker url"" together then use this wrong linked url to request
the server side, which cause a NotFound exception.
Closes-bug: #1560862
Change-Id: I416b63758373dc8ad29818d6952d1e9dd58d05f2

openstack%2Fkolla~master~Ie10116010156c13742a0a5d37c440c713e4698e5,openstack/kolla,master,bug/1561347,Ie10116010156c13742a0a5d37c440c713e4698e5,Revert ""Fix consistently failing CentOS gate""",MERGED,2016-03-24 12:37:03.000000000,2016-03-30 14:59:46.000000000,2016-03-30 14:59:46.000000000,1,2,6,297084,3f707d78df08badac2a9a289ca498cc7cb684b4f,23,8,5,1,14119,Sam Yaple,SamYaple,"Revert ""Fix consistently failing CentOS gate""
This reverts commit 17e0de6aa6c32c5adebeffc90c96f15285877cf5.
This change should have never merged. There is something else going on
here and the bug doesnt fully invetigate the issue. Using a mix of
system and pip packages is not acceptable and can cause problems.
In this case the packaged mysql has a KNOWN issue that we fixed in
liberty by switching to the pip installed package.

openstack%2Fironic-inspector~stable%2Fliberty~I9a53c3bedd4106a4b03647209ea2a49efa4b2a47,openstack/ironic-inspector,stable/liberty,source-gate,I9a53c3bedd4106a4b03647209ea2a49efa4b2a47,[devstack] Use the coreos builder for the source build of the ramdisk,MERGED,2016-03-30 11:50:40.000000000,2016-03-30 14:57:08.000000000,2016-03-30 14:57:08.000000000,3,10,0,299327,e13a9267ba558da2e88e1b2f9166ba8362bb1989,14,3,1,1,10239,Dmitry Tantsur,dtantsur,[devstack] Use the coreos builder for the source build of the ramdisk

openstack%2Fpython-designateclient~master~If9306b27d78d7c774911d3c1abb46bfbf72539f1,openstack/python-designateclient,master,test-service-catalog-bypass,If9306b27d78d7c774911d3c1abb46bfbf72539f1,Add a service catalog override to the functional tests,MERGED,2016-02-24 20:25:11.000000000,2016-03-30 14:56:34.000000000,2016-03-30 14:56:34.000000000,27,1,1,284397,38e9fa850589c336a0907ee0e7f26c56cd60b82e,8,3,1,2,11662,Paul Glass,pglass,Add a service catalog override to the functional tests
This allows us to run the functional tests against environments than
what's in the service catalog.
note: ideally, this would allow us to run against a Designate in
noauth mode. And it does, however there's not a way to pass in the
X-Auth-Project-ID header, so the tests will always use the
noauth-project (tests involving multiple users like, zone transfer
tests, won't work).
Change-Id: If9306b27d78d7c774911d3c1abb46bfbf72539f1

openstack%2Fnova~stable%2Fmitaka~I62a7ff16f1c9c5da923451520fbeeabb5cc0c5c6,openstack/nova,stable/mitaka,bug/1560860,I62a7ff16f1c9c5da923451520fbeeabb5cc0c5c6,Fix detach SR-IOV when using LibvirtConfigGuestHostdevPCI,MERGED,2016-03-30 02:04:28.000000000,2016-03-30 14:50:31.000000000,2016-03-30 14:37:14.000000000,27,24,0,299087,a9d55427b6e8d2472088e3d40a8a5151ce408283,13,6,1,2,6873,Matt Riedemann,mriedem,Fix detach SR-IOV when using LibvirtConfigGuestHostdevPCI
This patch fixes an issue which was introduced by this
change If3edc1965c01a077eb61984a442e0d778d870d75.
Usually the vif config is of type LibvirtConfigGuestInterface,
but some vif use LibvirtConfigGuestHostdevPCI config
(e.g.  the ib_hostdev). The difference is that
LibvirtConfigGuestInterface keeps the pci address in source_dev
while LibvirtConfigGuestHostdevPCI has domain, bus, slot and
function, instead of relying on the vif config type we can take the
pci address for the neutron port.
Closes-Bug: #1560860
Change-Id: I62a7ff16f1c9c5da923451520fbeeabb5cc0c5c6
(cherry picked from commit f15d9a9693b19393fcde84cf4bc6f044d39ffdca)

openstack%2Fnova~master~Ia90a4bd2f15ec4a7abbd44c2129f1934dc1057ac,openstack/nova,master,bp/refresh-quotas-usage,Ia90a4bd2f15ec4a7abbd44c2129f1934dc1057ac,Add nova-manage quota_usage_refresh command,ABANDONED,2016-03-26 18:37:35.000000000,2016-03-30 14:31:22.000000000,,482,48,8,297977,41b89c788973a3ae46709f5ea0c5324f59288c3b,34,22,4,7,17139,Chuck Carmack,ccarmack,Add nova-manage quota_usage_refresh command

openstack%2Fneutron~master~Ide76f9fdfba228000ddfa41a1168e77d21e92d9f,openstack/neutron,master,bp/bgp-dynamic-routing,Ide76f9fdfba228000ddfa41a1168e77d21e92d9f,Add BGP Callback and agent RPC notifcation implementations,MERGED,2015-08-26 06:24:39.000000000,2016-03-30 14:17:18.000000000,2016-03-09 03:45:25.000000000,248,14,80,216994,8bf46be67cc543cc3938122708a67271ce2eb7aa,560,30,42,5,4187,Ryan Tidwell,ryan-tidwell,Add BGP Callback and agent RPC notifcation implementations
This patch adds RPC calls to the BGP speaker service plugin. This enables
the service plugin to notify the appropriate BGP dynamic routing agents
(bgp_dragent) when tenants add router gateway ports, router interfaces,
associate/disassociate floating IP's, and when and admin binds/unbinds
a gateway network to a BGP speaker. Compatible with centralized routers,
distributed routers not supported.
Partially-Implements: blueprint bgp-dynamic-routing
Co-Authored-By: vikram.choudhary <vikram.choudhary@huawei.com>
Change-Id: Ide76f9fdfba228000ddfa41a1168e77d21e92d9f

openstack%2Ftuning-box~master~I213ea8f039ac2001407e24a475848c3fc348f443,openstack/tuning-box,master,,I213ea8f039ac2001407e24a475848c3fc348f443,Fix overrides redirect (was redirecting to /values),MERGED,2016-03-30 14:00:03.000000000,2016-03-30 14:09:42.000000000,2016-03-30 14:09:42.000000000,29,2,0,299421,d13bff5da069b5ceae070438cb7ec34462ecc474,6,2,1,2,708,Yuriy Taraday,yorik-sar,Fix overrides redirect (was redirecting to /values)

openstack%2Foslo.utils~master~Ib986ccaf95a19ef14fef1cebe39fc87c17c2769f,openstack/oslo.utils,master,,Ib986ccaf95a19ef14fef1cebe39fc87c17c2769f,Add excutils.exception_filter,MERGED,2016-03-29 18:48:10.000000000,2016-03-30 14:09:32.000000000,2016-03-30 14:09:32.000000000,314,0,3,298935,081669be91450696c05a31521060227897ad4658,12,4,2,2,4257,Zane Bitter,zaneb,Add excutils.exception_filter
This is a useful decorator for writing a simple function to filter or
translate exceptions based on criteria more complex than simply the
(super)class (i.e. in situations that aren't amenable to being handled
by simply matching subclasses with Python's exception handling syntax).
For example, this can be used to filter on the HTTP status code from a
generic client exception.
Unlike a naive implementation at the point of need or using contextlib
to create a reusable context manager, using this library class also
makes it easy to ensure that any exceptions that are re-raised (not
filtered) retain the same traceback.
Change-Id: Ib986ccaf95a19ef14fef1cebe39fc87c17c2769f

openstack%2Fapi-sig~master~I9832270b3d8210bff9cd2d9732b4d19f757f865a,openstack/api-sig,master,tags,I9832270b3d8210bff9cd2d9732b4d19f757f865a,Added tags restrictions to the tagging guidelines,MERGED,2016-02-05 12:41:44.000000000,2016-03-30 13:55:00.000000000,2016-03-30 13:55:00.000000000,20,2,17,276709,70cb95394df9cddca3ed6fc18b2711892c879167,72,16,14,1,9569,Sergey Nikitin,snikitin,Added tags restrictions to the tagging guidelines
One problem with tag names was found during tag
implementation in Nova Ibc44228aeae94c17353af7fccfcfb2c11b2e9190
This problems was connected with URLs. We can't
use '/' in names because in this case we will get a incorrect
URL for tag 'abc/cba': /servers/<server_id>/tags/abc/cba
Even if '/' will be encoded like %2F. Nova will decide
that it is '/'.
But this is not a problem of Nova. Unfortunately some servers
works incorrectly with encoded character '/'. It's a problem of poor
implementation of some servers. To escape problems with handling URLs
character '/' should be forbidden in tag names.
Change-Id: I9832270b3d8210bff9cd2d9732b4d19f757f865a

Currently, when execute devstack/stack.sh,
agent tarball is downloaded every time even if
it exists already.
This patch set

openstack%2Ftripleo-heat-templates~stable%2Fmitaka~I02b17b66e93331ddfb1a7abd8adff672bc7a32d6,openstack/tripleo-heat-templates,stable/mitaka,bug/1563437,I02b17b66e93331ddfb1a7abd8adff672bc7a32d6,compute: restart OVS agent on neutron.conf changes,MERGED,2016-03-30 11:17:20.000000000,2016-03-30 13:39:03.000000000,2016-03-30 13:39:03.000000000,10,0,0,299305,03f1ce70779c87742addfee573845e7188400310,8,7,1,1,8449,Marios Andreou,marios,compute: restart OVS agent on neutron.conf changes
Some options in neutron.conf are used bu OVS agent, like logging &
messaging.
During the upgrade process, you need to restart the agent if these
options change.
We could patch puppet-neutron to add a notify, but the community won't
like it because Neutron OVS agent is not able to restart gracefully
until [1] got merged. Until that, we can fix it in TripleO, where we
suppose Puppet runs happenning during bootstraps and upgrades.
Later, we'll drop this code from here and move it in puppet-neutron.
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/297211
Change-Id: I02b17b66e93331ddfb1a7abd8adff672bc7a32d6
Closes-Bug: #1563437
(cherry picked from commit bc00cf7e99e68b61450234de1ecfb4aa96aec174)

openstack%2Ffuel-library~master~Id3c6aaafaf98836091974db9060ac628837c1e22,openstack/fuel-library,master,bug/1519722,Id3c6aaafaf98836091974db9060ac628837c1e22,Refactor nova quota usage,MERGED,2016-03-16 17:01:06.000000000,2016-03-30 13:33:31.000000000,2016-03-30 13:32:39.000000000,51,42,4,293574,356015190989cc156b4ead88314dafd51913d8d7,107,17,8,2,13752,Alexey Deryugin,velovec,Refactor nova quota usage
Remove deprecated options and introduce new quota options.
Right now we use some deprecated parameters from onva module:
quota_volumes, quota_gigabytes and have no ability to use new options,
like: quota_ram, quota_fixed_ips, quota_security_group_rules,
quota_server_groups, quota_server_group_members.
This patch switches to usage of new parameters.
Change-Id: Id3c6aaafaf98836091974db9060ac628837c1e22
Closes-Bug: #1519722

openstack%2Fneutron~master~I1e2cffd6cf26c3a7cba3e9b401e9a4ee25e6e316,openstack/neutron,master,,I1e2cffd6cf26c3a7cba3e9b401e9a4ee25e6e316,Add new table to fix HA network concurrency,ABANDONED,2016-03-16 23:10:23.000000000,2016-03-30 13:21:56.000000000,,119,20,7,293757,4c9c0feab55f40a4341c18fdebc6d0d079322edc,25,17,2,4,10267,venkata anil,anil,Add new table to fix HA network concurrency
New table ""L3HARouterNetworkBinding"" added to save which routers
are using HA network.
During router delete,
1)router entry from this new table is auto deleted.
2)tries to delete HA network from ""L3HARouterNetwork"", and will be
succesful if no other routers are using this network in
""L3HARouterNetworkBinding"", otherwise fails.
3)tries to delete network from ""networks"" table, and will be
succesful only if the network is not present in both ""L3HARouterNetwork""
and ""L3HARouterNetworkBinding"" tables.
Similarly concurrent creation of HA network and entries in
L3HARouterNetwork and L3HARouterNetworkBinding tables by
multiple workers is also safe.
Need to take care of alembic migrations and UTs.
Change-Id: I1e2cffd6cf26c3a7cba3e9b401e9a4ee25e6e316

openstack%2Fneutron~master~I685291058f221a7ef0b5b7485280cdabceaa4af3,openstack/neutron,master,bug/1552960,I685291058f221a7ef0b5b7485280cdabceaa4af3,Delete 118~ API tests from Neutron,MERGED,2016-02-15 22:10:33.000000000,2016-03-30 13:04:00.000000000,2016-03-11 00:57:58.000000000,29,2517,41,280427,ddd5df95266cf872a852577d16d9c5d188b4e13a,132,29,10,17,8873,Assaf Muller,amuller,Delete 118~ API tests from Neutron
Deleted tests that duplicate tests from Tempest, according to the
new criteria specified in TESTING.rst.
Follow up steps are detailed here:
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron-tempest-defork
For reviewers, here's how to get a complete list of network
tests from Tempest. From a Tempest directory, execute:
testr list-tests tempest.api.network | cut -d""["" -f1 | cut -d""."" -f4-
I verified that every test removed here actually exists in that list.
Here's a list of patches that modified tests after the fork:
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron-tempest-defork-patches-since-initial-sync
And the list of tests we care about:
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron-tempest-defork, Ctrl-F for:
'Tests that should be synced from Neutron'
Related-bug: #1552960
Change-Id: I685291058f221a7ef0b5b7485280cdabceaa4af3

openstack%2Fpython-novaclient~master~If653a247d842786d2824b4b3a5c0cde1383ed7ab,openstack/python-novaclient,master,bug/1559072,If653a247d842786d2824b4b3a5c0cde1383ed7ab,Handle error response for webob>=1.6.0,MERGED,2016-03-18 23:20:14.000000000,2016-03-30 12:59:24.000000000,2016-03-30 12:59:24.000000000,63,3,1,294850,fa377e7fca44e81247639efebd7cae5cb377e57e,16,6,3,2,6873,Matt Riedemann,mriedem,Handle error response for webob>=1.6.0
WebOb change https://github.com/Pylons/webob/pull/230 changed
the way in which the error response body is formatted such that
it's no longer a nested dict. So we have to handle both the
old convention of an error message key to the response body error
dict and the new way with just the error body dict.
This was reported upstream:
https://github.com/Pylons/webob/issues/235
But given this was apparently implemented as a long-overdue change
in WebOb the behavior is not likely to change.
Change-Id: If653a247d842786d2824b4b3a5c0cde1383ed7ab
Closes-Bug: #1559072

openstack%2Ffuel-web~master~Iaa5b245680e7257ff46b5ddc1b7aa9400284e705,openstack/fuel-web,master,synch-tests,Iaa5b245680e7257ff46b5ddc1b7aa9400284e705,Don't use threads when running integration tests,MERGED,2016-03-20 06:30:33.000000000,2016-03-30 12:39:32.000000000,2016-03-30 12:27:34.000000000,276,354,28,294976,8f4a99c13f44de0e2cfc891aca32dcdc0a2bcfb5,122,12,11,29,406,Mike Scherbakov,mihgen,Don't use threads when running integration tests
Nailgun integration tests use fake tasks, which run in threads.
This has been causing random failures. Although those failures could
of been fixed by different sorts of improvements, increasing timeouts,
etc. - this is still not an ideal solution.
Proposed patch removes use of threads in tests. All fake tasks code
which used to be running in threads only is ran synchronously for tests.
Threads are still used for fakeUI as before.
More details about random test failures can be found in mailing list:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-March/089514.html
Change-Id: Iaa5b245680e7257ff46b5ddc1b7aa9400284e705

openstack%2Fproject-config~master~If617d1ccf55e469a7ccd5647ab7358436971fd00,openstack/project-config,master,add-microversion-parse,If617d1ccf55e469a7ccd5647ab7358436971fd00,Add a microversion-parse project,MERGED,2016-03-22 20:53:23.000000000,2016-03-30 12:36:17.000000000,2016-03-30 12:36:17.000000000,35,0,4,296046,e7fc4e91734063ad07ba86dda10d125ef293c220,26,7,2,5,11564,Chris Dent,chdent,Add a microversion-parse project
Modern microversion headers can be tricky to parse so a group of
concerned citizens decided we need a small library to parse them
in a consistent fashion. This adds a project, microversion-parse,
that contains a python library to do so. It's upstream is at
https://github.com/cdent/microversion-parse
For this project, no distinction is made in gerrit between core,
release, or stable maintainers. Core can do any of these.
Change-Id: If617d1ccf55e469a7ccd5647ab7358436971fd00

openstack%2Ffuel-agent~master~Id9635b4a1ce237927c57e91a5c20c3f229ee3fcc,openstack/fuel-agent,master,bug/1559197,Id9635b4a1ce237927c57e91a5c20c3f229ee3fcc,Add LVM filters and preferred_names into LVM config,MERGED,2016-03-21 13:16:42.000000000,2016-03-30 12:27:52.000000000,2016-03-30 12:27:52.000000000,210,62,40,295272,3959c7d6911b3485f24416808c48f4ab8a6ce3bf,132,8,24,6,9377,Sergey Slipushenko,sslypushenko,Add LVM filters and preferred_names into LVM config
If we have some multipath block devices on the node, we need
to prevent LVM from grubbing multipath underlying devices during boot into
target OS. To achieve it, we have to whitelist in LVM filters all
non-multipath devices from /dev/disk/by-id dir and force LVM to scan
/dev/mapper dir for volume groups on multipath devices
Change-Id: Id9635b4a1ce237927c57e91a5c20c3f229ee3fcc
Closes-Bug: #1559197
Closes-Bug: #1562874

openstack%2Fapi-sig~master~I416ff1dd35249674fb27f9dd7625786e52001556,openstack/api-sig,master,process-clarify,I416ff1dd35249674fb27f9dd7625786e52001556,Clarify the guideline proposal process,MERGED,2016-03-29 12:47:09.000000000,2016-03-30 12:27:44.000000000,2016-03-30 12:27:44.000000000,64,57,1,298719,c3a5ba0b086cc83c46204ebf346a085a53a54b8e,14,7,2,1,11564,Chris Dent,chdent,Clarify the guideline proposal process
The steps in the proposal process were interleaved in a way
that made following them confusing. This change extracts the
definitions of terms from the actual process and simplifies the
process.
For the most part the spirit of the staged review process is
maintained but the steps required to reach out to the community
are clarified: Where there is consensus we involve just the CPLs.
Where there is not we reach out to the rest of community. I'm not
certain is the correct way to go. It's a compromise between keeping
things moving with minimal friction and including the broader
community as much as possible.
My hope is that this will help to clarify the term ""frozen"" and
when freezing is to be done.
This will probably require some iteration.

openstack%2Fneutron~master~I428384fd42181ff6bc33f29369a7ff5ec163b532,openstack/neutron,master,bug/1561040,I428384fd42181ff6bc33f29369a7ff5ec163b532,Ignore exception when deleting linux bridge if doesn't exist,MERGED,2016-03-23 15:27:05.000000000,2016-03-30 12:19:13.000000000,2016-03-25 04:35:36.000000000,31,7,5,296537,16b2ffdfd85eece8fb57a98d10bf35ad617d235a,42,15,3,2,10267,venkata anil,anil,Ignore exception when deleting linux bridge if doesn't exist
Linux bridge is not handling RuntimeError exception when it is trying
to delete network's bridge, which is deleted in parallel by nova.
Fullstack test has similar scenario, it creates network's bridge for
agent and deletes the bridge after the test, like nova.
Linux bridge agent has to ignore RuntimeError exception if the bridge
doesn't exist.
Closes-bug: #1561040
Change-Id: I428384fd42181ff6bc33f29369a7ff5ec163b532

openstack%2Fos-win~master~I991e3f664868266e84fde1471b38965b7ad04ca4,openstack/os-win,master,,I991e3f664868266e84fde1471b38965b7ad04ca4,Consistently raise exception if port not found,MERGED,2016-03-30 00:13:38.000000000,2016-03-30 12:08:55.000000000,2016-03-30 11:49:10.000000000,27,36,0,299038,c5ea2aaca942cccdc4a37156835c4e4cf7cb04cc,14,4,2,2,8213,Claudiu Belu,claudiub,Consistently raise exception if port not found
Doesn't raise an exception on remove_switch_port. If a VM is
destroyed, all of its associated vNICs and switch ports are also
destroyed. The Neutron Hyper-V Agent will notice this fact and
call the remove_switch_port. The Agent will also receive a port_delete
RPC call for the already destroyed port.
Closes-Bug: #1563775
Change-Id: I991e3f664868266e84fde1471b38965b7ad04ca4

UI. The search bar extneds to the entire remaining width of the
screen, and small adjustments have been made to the title
to offer more space in smaller form factors. It was necessary
to move the branding into header.html, in order to permit

that experience should probably receive its own treatment.

openstack%2Fcinder~master~Id3571cbfa7c66787573cf750735be33a440d15dc,openstack/cinder,master,bug/1552169,Id3571cbfa7c66787573cf750735be33a440d15dc,Continue volume delete on encryption key delete errors,MERGED,2016-03-02 11:43:02.000000000,2016-03-30 11:45:53.000000000,2016-03-14 21:54:16.000000000,15,2,11,287125,e4bf3e0cc00db52e7bc19be7707d2677a72cd62f,103,35,4,2,1207,Duncan Thomas,duncan-thomas,Continue volume delete on encryption key delete errors

openstack%2Ftripleo-heat-templates~stable%2Fmitaka~Id9bb4b12542f1943e9df702486d68424539c7a59,openstack/tripleo-heat-templates,stable/mitaka,bug/1560934,Id9bb4b12542f1943e9df702486d68424539c7a59,Add quotes around the cinder_iscsi_ip_address value,MERGED,2016-03-29 15:34:45.000000000,2016-03-30 11:30:42.000000000,2016-03-30 11:30:42.000000000,10,2,0,298828,3195660dcd447ba4ffd7d384e57f0b2614c72650,14,4,1,2,6796,Giulio Fidente,gfidente,Add quotes around the cinder_iscsi_ip_address value

openstack%2Ftripleo-heat-templates~stable%2Fmitaka~I95e21e10471cd7575f28c095c48150325f1414b3,openstack/tripleo-heat-templates,stable/mitaka,bug/1562922,I95e21e10471cd7575f28c095c48150325f1414b3,Don't restart Pacemaker-managed services from Puppet,MERGED,2016-03-29 16:04:50.000000000,2016-03-30 11:23:11.000000000,2016-03-30 11:23:11.000000000,18,0,0,298847,f3215d28ba6693e8e513cc3ae2aba3e500a0a4f0,15,4,1,1,8042,Jiří Stránský,jistr,Don't restart Pacemaker-managed services from Puppet
We need to reload/restart services on updates/upgrades to apply any
config changes, but restarting services managed from Pacemaker from
Puppet causes problems.
For now we no-op the restart and rely on the catch-all restart after
Puppet phase.
In the future we should have a service provider for pacemaker resources
that will be using pcs. We still might have to restart services outside
Puppet due to cluster-wide orchestration issues, but we might be able to
do the restarts selectively rather than restart everything.
We also no-op the start/stop commands to be safe, as it also doesn't
make sense for Puppet to try start and stop those services when it
doesn't have knowledge about Pacemaker.
Closes-Bug: #1562922
(cherry picked from commit 7b2e56053f6cf7535c7ae416c5cb41e7c9679924)

openstack%2Ftripleo-heat-templates~master~I16bf6d5a91846ab8a3596d8b1a30a161c137b2e1,openstack/tripleo-heat-templates,master,bug/1562893,I16bf6d5a91846ab8a3596d8b1a30a161c137b2e1,Move heat keystone domain to end of step 3,ABANDONED,2016-03-28 15:49:41.000000000,2016-03-30 11:21:42.000000000,,16,23,3,298295,1e6e15a548647b25f753c68a79e4fd63f7973a76,21,5,3,1,7144,James Slagle,slagle,Move heat keystone domain to end of step 3
Creating the heat keystone domain via puppet-heat makes use of
heat_config resources. See:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/puppet-heat/tree/manifests/keystone/domain.pp#n98
When doing this in step 5, this causes the openstack-heat-* services to
be restarted via systemctl. However, given that the services are already
managed by pacemaker, this can causes races with systemctl and pacemaker
competing to stop/start the service.
Change-Id: I16bf6d5a91846ab8a3596d8b1a30a161c137b2e1
Partial-Bug: #1562893

openstack%2Fironic~master~Ib744346e8cfe936e64c3a98e5bc210480429a0c3,openstack/ironic,master,deploy_utils_tests,Ib744346e8cfe936e64c3a98e5bc210480429a0c3,Move testcases related to parse_instance_info(),MERGED,2016-03-24 14:36:12.000000000,2016-03-30 11:20:00.000000000,2016-03-30 11:20:00.000000000,264,266,1,297186,43fb7291913d6bbc87aae253dc911c688f78e3d4,16,7,2,2,11076,Shivanand Tendulker,stendulker,Move testcases related to parse_instance_info()

openstack%2Ftripleo-heat-templates~master~I02b17b66e93331ddfb1a7abd8adff672bc7a32d6,openstack/tripleo-heat-templates,master,bug/1563437,I02b17b66e93331ddfb1a7abd8adff672bc7a32d6,compute: restart OVS agent on neutron.conf changes,MERGED,2016-03-29 19:28:06.000000000,2016-03-30 11:19:41.000000000,2016-03-30 09:35:19.000000000,10,0,0,298946,bc00cf7e99e68b61450234de1ecfb4aa96aec174,9,3,1,1,3153,Emilien Macchi,emilienm,compute: restart OVS agent on neutron.conf changes
Some options in neutron.conf are used bu OVS agent, like logging &
messaging.
During the upgrade process, you need to restart the agent if these
options change.
We could patch puppet-neutron to add a notify, but the community won't
like it because Neutron OVS agent is not able to restart gracefully
until [1] got merged. Until that, we can fix it in TripleO, where we
suppose Puppet runs happenning during bootstraps and upgrades.
Later, we'll drop this code from here and move it in puppet-neutron.
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/297211
Change-Id: I02b17b66e93331ddfb1a7abd8adff672bc7a32d6
Closes-Bug: #1563437

openstack%2Fcharm-cinder~master~I2fd46e96e60dd60462a4ffa89f7f84e9fd31d234,openstack/charm-cinder,master,bug/1563340,I2fd46e96e60dd60462a4ffa89f7f84e9fd31d234,cinder-backup service should be optional,MERGED,2016-03-30 07:37:30.000000000,2016-03-30 10:58:36.000000000,2016-03-30 09:34:29.000000000,261,146,1,299180,f434b40b04cada91036842a8d363c6699d7936f8,16,4,3,2,12549,gnuoy,gnuoy,cinder-backup service should be optional
The charm has cinder-backup listed as a core service which should always be
restarted on changes to config. However, cinder-backup is only present if
installed by the cinder-backup subordinate charm. The new pause/resume code
will put the charm in a blocked state in this case so it needs fixing.
This charm was not using some of the openstack charm conventions such as using
register_configs with resource_map and using hook_context rather context as
the key in resource map dict. These have been fixed.
Closes-Bug: 1563340
Change-Id: I2fd46e96e60dd60462a4ffa89f7f84e9fd31d234

openstack%2Fkolla~master~I4e08bca95493b2dbd0ad5f8d1ea4e07b18c4959d,openstack/kolla,master,bug/1563500,I4e08bca95493b2dbd0ad5f8d1ea4e07b18c4959d,Added precheck to check kernel version 4.2 on Ubuntu 14.04.,MERGED,2016-03-30 00:54:04.000000000,2016-03-30 10:54:03.000000000,2016-03-30 09:34:35.000000000,10,0,2,299047,833c1269c7941498787d49ce879be6c283728407,13,3,3,2,17731,Carlos Cesario,ccesario,Added precheck to check kernel version 4.2 on Ubuntu 14.04.
Kolla recommends LTS wily kernel version 4.2 on Ubuntu 14.04.
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/kolla/quickstart.html#installing-dependencies
The precheck check the running kernel version, because checking
the linux-image-generic-lts-wily cannot be a valid check.
The package (linux-image-generic-lts-wily) can be installed, but
the running kernel can be other version.
Closes-Bug: #1563500
Co-Authored-By: Vikram Hosakote <vhosakot@cisco.com>
Change-Id: I4e08bca95493b2dbd0ad5f8d1ea4e07b18c4959d

openstack%2Ffuel-library~master~Ia9a7d489a01f713c03be256b7765335dc0836ea4,openstack/fuel-library,master,task-based-bugs-plugins,Ia9a7d489a01f713c03be256b7765335dc0836ea4,Remove possibility for graph loop in neutron tasks,MERGED,2016-03-16 19:37:38.000000000,2016-03-30 10:44:52.000000000,2016-03-30 10:44:10.000000000,6,0,0,293676,6e0ac440afefa4993867b88372fe80f836f5e4ed,119,8,12,1,8786,Vladimir Kuklin,aglarendil,Remove possibility for graph loop in neutron tasks
This commit strips extra dependencies between controller
and compute neutron tasks making it less probable for

openstack%2Ffuel-stats~master~I65faf43c28427594495c67696ca190e7fe29f083,openstack/fuel-stats,master,bug/1556876,I65faf43c28427594495c67696ca190e7fe29f083,Cleaning test DB without Alembic migrations,MERGED,2016-03-14 15:03:59.000000000,2016-03-30 10:42:02.000000000,2016-03-30 10:42:02.000000000,88,8,7,292437,ea6263af70495797d82e77f86ca821f4d04c9c28,42,8,4,2,10959,Alexander Kislitsky,akislitsky,Cleaning test DB without Alembic migrations
On the Fuel CI we have no rights to drop and create DB.
In the tests we are downgrading and upgrading DB schema by Alembic
migrations. In case of adding migrations in one review we had
all other reviews broken due to Alembic failures on attempt to
downgrade DB schema.
As fix we are fallback to the cleaning DB without migrations
in case of Alembic error on the schema downgrade.
Closes-Bug: #1556876
