openstack%2Fneutron~master~Ia518a99a2de5d1bda467fde57892c43970f88bcd,openstack/neutron,master,bug/1514056,Ia518a99a2de5d1bda467fde57892c43970f88bcd,Don't delete br-int to br-tun patch on startup,MERGED,2016-03-24 15:22:29.000000000,2016-03-30 10:31:30.000000000,2016-03-30 10:30:32.000000000,15,3,5,297211,8dce6a5c873c2c18e5a9c6165bf3974aead02588,94,22,7,3,10540,Clayton O'Neill,coneill,Don't delete br-int to br-tun patch on startup
When starting up, we don't want to delete the patch port between br-int
and br-tun unless we're also dropping the flows..  In liberty both of
these bridges were switched to not dump flows on startup and to put the
bridges in secure mode so that default flood flows are not installed
when the bridge is created.
Without this patch the patch port is torn down and not reinstalled until
br-tun is setup again.
Partial-Bug: #1514056
Change-Id: Ia518a99a2de5d1bda467fde57892c43970f88bcd

openstack%2Fmurano~master~I440d2985f9122dad53c81b15148e60df4e7e9583,openstack/murano,master,bug/1548857,I440d2985f9122dad53c81b15148e60df4e7e9583,Do not upgrade packages with cloud-init,MERGED,2016-03-29 17:04:24.000000000,2016-03-30 09:21:11.000000000,2016-03-30 09:21:11.000000000,0,4,0,298876,54e115c60b74084a0d6b0b8595b11252f08ab7a3,29,6,3,2,20563,Omar Shykhkerimov,oshykhkerimov,Do not upgrade packages with cloud-init
This patch deletes 'package_upgrade: true' option from cloud-init confs.
It caused upgrading of all the packages in the images spawned by murano.
This made spawning VMs slow and in certain cases caused
dpkg locks be still in place when murano-agent attempted to
install packages
Change-Id: I440d2985f9122dad53c81b15148e60df4e7e9583
Closes-Bug: 1548857

Change-Id: If3d3d6683d05748018c86ca397e57f8c41b328ce
SubMapper.connect allows in Routes<=2.2 to define routes with/without a
name:
map.connect(route_name, route_path)
map.connect(route_path)
Routes==2.3 SubMapper.connect now requires a route name (but not
Mapper.connect). This change adds a route name when needed to support
Routes<=2.2 and Routes==2.3.

Change-Id: I655bfe7f047945896d63dd94c584acfe60d81b38

openstack%2Fproject-config~master~If8b4e412f8ae48c6c0133634df4a95d10a876be3,openstack/project-config,master,bindep,If8b4e412f8ae48c6c0133634df4a95d10a876be3,Remove sbcl from bindep-fallback.txt,MERGED,2016-03-28 13:20:33.000000000,2016-03-30 09:11:26.000000000,2016-03-30 09:11:26.000000000,0,1,0,298229,4c77d447f8849e445be2a104cd2db7fcfd9a9be1,12,3,2,1,6547,Andreas Jaeger,jaegerandi,Remove sbcl from bindep-fallback.txt
The sbcl (common lisp) package is only needed by cl-openstack-client.
That repo now has an other-requirements.txt file, so we do not need
to install sbcl for every project and thus can remove it from
bindep-fallback.txt.
Note that cl-openstack-client does not work currently with sbcl at all,
so we cannot merge the related change at the moment.
Related change: Ie1ecb184bd825aea4dbb315cf125b991ae22d682
Change-Id: If8b4e412f8ae48c6c0133634df4a95d10a876be3

openstack%2Fproject-config~master~I3a15946994b21850fd491b21190a50b7da415896,openstack/project-config,master,bindep-test,I3a15946994b21850fd491b21190a50b7da415896,Run bindep on project-config only if needed,MERGED,2016-03-25 18:43:23.000000000,2016-03-30 09:11:18.000000000,2016-03-30 09:11:18.000000000,28,16,2,297809,c95546523a14d178e0220aedf331d4e1e3e7cd3c,16,5,3,3,6547,Andreas Jaeger,jaegerandi,Run bindep on project-config only if needed
Run the bindep fallback jobs on project-config only if the bindep
fallback list has changed.
We first have to duplicate the job so that we can limit the
project-config version of it.

openstack%2Ffuel-main~master~I634c42d2a8420a3ea35ce3fdae54ab499e9ea154,openstack/fuel-main,master,,I634c42d2a8420a3ea35ce3fdae54ab499e9ea154,Fuel master deployment fails due to disk size,MERGED,2016-03-15 17:11:30.000000000,2016-03-30 08:59:38.000000000,2016-03-30 08:59:37.000000000,3,3,0,293054,83feeb06154e27947310ff0fd55ef68b32d19f47,21,12,2,1,20316,Marcellin Fom Tchassem,ciello89,Fuel master deployment fails due to disk size

as part of the master install is not sufficient enough
to deploy 8.0 with docker containers.

be 50gb
https://docs.mirantis.com/openstack/fuel/fuel-8.0/fuel-install-guide.html#
This patch will resolve this issue, will set the minimum
disk size requirement to 50gb and will change the related
error message.
Closes-Bug: #1557628
Change-Id: I634c42d2a8420a3ea35ce3fdae54ab499e9ea154

openstack%2Fcharm-ceph-radosgw~master~I4052cda5bb20f76ab592ed7817bdc1e5b5b2138d,openstack/charm-ceph-radosgw,master,bug/1563667,I4052cda5bb20f76ab592ed7817bdc1e5b5b2138d,Check if /var/lib/ceph/nss exists before creation,MERGED,2016-03-30 05:31:25.000000000,2016-03-30 08:59:29.000000000,2016-03-30 08:59:29.000000000,4,2,2,299128,b0338f7283b7d2fb25471e23b8325147e7d9cb34,14,4,3,1,21107,Trent Lloyd,lathiat,Check if /var/lib/ceph/nss exists before creation
mkdir() throws an exception if the directory already exists, so we should check
for it's existance before creation as hooks should be idempotent.
This occurred in practice when the install hook had to be re-run, following a
previous failure due to juju API timeout.  It would also occur if the keystone
relation was re-built, so that case is also fixed.
Change-Id: I4052cda5bb20f76ab592ed7817bdc1e5b5b2138d
Closes-Bug: #1563667

openstack%2Ffuel-library~master~I9ba428ac4e70cf7d7309054ccb63a46d496a8b4c,openstack/fuel-library,master,unicode,I9ba428ac4e70cf7d7309054ccb63a46d496a8b4c,Don't override LC_ALL,MERGED,2016-03-25 16:37:00.000000000,2016-03-30 08:38:14.000000000,2016-03-30 08:36:45.000000000,0,1,0,297755,738a804960b8276e85eebd1fd3e37ba8212de122,33,14,2,1,20517,Dmitry Burmistrov,dmburmistrov,Don't override LC_ALL
In Ubuntu (14.04) LC_ALL is not set by default,
other variables are set with UTF-8. Such combi-
nation of settings is valid for working with
non-ASCII characters.
Setting LC_ALL to ""C"" will override all other
LC_* settings and force ASCII usage. This obstructs
the work with Unicode variables in OSC arguments
(e.g. command 'glance image-create --name 試験画像'
will fail)
As OS works with UTF-8, so we shouldn't hinder.
Change-Id: I9ba428ac4e70cf7d7309054ccb63a46d496a8b4c
Closes-bug: #1543102

openstack%2Ffuel-library~master~I572bd72b6c9571a49deec9ee683f8e0d76bed9ae,openstack/fuel-library,master,rmq_config_opts,I572bd72b6c9571a49deec9ee683f8e0d76bed9ae,Merge rabbitmq default config vars w/ custom ones,MERGED,2016-03-23 12:46:01.000000000,2016-03-30 08:37:37.000000000,2016-03-30 08:36:37.000000000,14,12,4,296415,9cec7696d1f39a6d339e497afcee31292cb7224e,38,15,2,2,16771,mpolenchuk,mpolenchuk,Merge rabbitmq default config vars w/ custom ones

openstack%2Fopenstack-manuals~master~Iee4df6c200f943dabc0ae3cea7184d4c1ae03153,openstack/openstack-manuals,master,update-hpe-3par-manila-docs,Iee4df6c200f943dabc0ae3cea7184d4c1ae03153,Update HPE 3PAR Shared File System Docs,MERGED,2016-03-22 22:12:44.000000000,2016-03-30 08:23:35.000000000,2016-03-30 08:23:35.000000000,72,7,54,296088,a342b80bfe530fa4a07a5e8f98b4acced1a0fb57,36,8,9,1,16917,Alex O'Rourke,aorourke,Update HPE 3PAR Shared File System Docs
With the Mitaka release multiple changes have been made to the
Manila driver:
- Access rules changes for both NFS and CIFS shares.
- IP and user access rules changes for both NFS and CIFS shares.
- Client version bump.

openstack%2Fneutron~master~If08d6595d9bc657a7ecfb487e8df40860837d200,openstack/neutron,master,bp/bgp-dynamic-routing,If08d6595d9bc657a7ecfb487e8df40860837d200,Add Queries For BGP Route Lookups,MERGED,2015-11-05 19:00:17.000000000,2016-03-30 08:20:17.000000000,2016-03-04 01:58:58.000000000,1198,4,52,242192,1c9e439e7a1bda5b665997816891111e679faf67,464,31,33,7,4187,Ryan Tidwell,ryan-tidwell,Add Queries For BGP Route Lookups

openstack%2Fproject-config~master~Ia01d37951d4ba49da6a55e90d8379f3a29e6975c,openstack/project-config,master,,Ia01d37951d4ba49da6a55e90d8379f3a29e6975c,devstack-plugin-nfs: Make tempest non-voting,MERGED,2016-03-29 14:27:08.000000000,2016-03-30 08:19:11.000000000,2016-03-30 08:19:11.000000000,2,3,2,298774,92079b08d182706aab28909c526aba71bce91e80,14,4,3,2,4523,Eric Harney,eharney,devstack-plugin-nfs: Make tempest non-voting
This is to resolve a chicken/egg problem with
this plugin.  The NFS code in Cinder is not yet in shape
to pass all tempest tests, and I'd like to use this
plugin to vet that code while it's in-progress with a
non-voting Cinder job.
So, allow commits to the plugin for now until everything
is up and running, and then this job can be made voting
again.
Change-Id: Ia01d37951d4ba49da6a55e90d8379f3a29e6975c

openstack%2Fdevstack~master~If92f0bdca16f866a475820cf71a30ded28fb2572,openstack/devstack,master,sileht/ceph,If92f0bdca16f866a475820cf71a30ded28fb2572,ceph: Allow to change the image path,ABANDONED,2016-03-28 14:59:23.000000000,2016-03-30 07:49:08.000000000,,1,1,0,298276,facc0c4e1bad22ce0c27ac70b6354d8c114669b9,6,4,1,1,2813,Mehdi Abaakouk,sileht,ceph: Allow to change the image path

won't work because some file operation needed by ceph are not allowed

whole CEPH_DATA_DIR.

openstack%2Fnetworking-ovn~master~Iacfec2260baa1b3fa026acd173a0bfe7709fc8d8,openstack/networking-ovn,master,bug/1546315,Iacfec2260baa1b3fa026acd173a0bfe7709fc8d8,Sync ACLs between Neutron and NB database,MERGED,2016-03-23 04:15:50.000000000,2016-03-30 07:45:02.000000000,2016-03-30 07:45:02.000000000,247,12,28,296170,54c3284d6cc3b390d6c24a7511da60ffc0d718bc,31,7,5,3,19728,Nirapada Ghosh,nirapada,Sync ACLs between Neutron and NB database
This patch modifies the existing ovn db sync tool to add
syncing of ACLS between neutron and NB database. It reads
the neutron DB, generates all the ACLs, reads the OVN NB
ACL list, compares them, adds the missing ones into NB
database and deletes the ones found in OVN northbound DB
but not found in neutron.
Related-bug: 1546315
Change-Id: Iacfec2260baa1b3fa026acd173a0bfe7709fc8d8

openstack%2Ftripleo-heat-templates~master~I020a98b620f2388ce69b7b00711476bb96d0c46b,openstack/tripleo-heat-templates,master,bug/1563437,I020a98b620f2388ce69b7b00711476bb96d0c46b,Adds a PostPuppetConfig for restart of neutron-openvswitch-agent,ABANDONED,2016-03-29 16:40:45.000000000,2016-03-30 07:44:48.000000000,,21,0,3,298865,8b9eea554900c39fee5935baa0107cab51610c4a,11,8,1,1,8449,Marios Andreou,marios,Adds a PostPuppetConfig for restart of neutron-openvswitch-agent
After running an upgrade to completion there is a problem with the
neutron-openvswitch-agent on compute nodes. It doesn't get
restarted and so doesn't pickup any neutron.conf change.
For upgrades we are changing the rabbit password and so the agent
can not talk to rabbit with the new password until it gets
restarted.
Closes-Bug: 1563437
Change-Id: I020a98b620f2388ce69b7b00711476bb96d0c46b

openstack%2Fwatcher-specs~master~I1c57a3b9f95670b02ebe91a6647e8aba0bcfb8fc,openstack/watcher-specs,master,bp/graph-based-cluster-model,I1c57a3b9f95670b02ebe91a6647e8aba0bcfb8fc,Graph model describing virtual and physical elements in a data center,ABANDONED,2016-03-29 16:58:39.000000000,2016-03-30 07:27:45.000000000,,232,0,0,298873,7ccc03425df3d4ba838e0479e7c5652e7495ae8d,3,1,1,1,20503,Grigorios Katsaros,gkatsaro,Graph model describing virtual and physical elements in a data center

openstack%2Fpython-novaclient~stable%2Fmitaka~I4dbeb6ebe03f03799b706be2d787d21484b5c664,openstack/python-novaclient,stable/mitaka,bug/1561938,I4dbeb6ebe03f03799b706be2d787d21484b5c664,Fix host-evacuate-live for 2.25 microversion,MERGED,2016-03-29 21:17:00.000000000,2016-03-30 07:16:56.000000000,2016-03-30 07:16:55.000000000,41,4,0,298988,b269aa4d7f40f259642474227e9258e982155f0d,13,4,1,2,6873,Matt Riedemann,mriedem,Fix host-evacuate-live for 2.25 microversion
Change I01b22593724616bc0a7793c509ecabf095d6927d made the
live_migrate() method in the ServerManager conditional on the
API version requested. This broke the host-evacuate-live
command which is calling ServerManager.live_migrate() directly
with one too many arguments for the v2.25 version of the method.
This updates the host-evacuate-live shell to behave like the
live-migration method and be aware of the API version when
calling the live_migrate() method.
Related to blueprint making-live-migration-api-friendly
Conflicts:
novaclient/v2/contrib/host_evacuate_live.py
NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to
93913c84b67d3aefe79bef106fbe9a83f0bcdb71 not being in stable/mitaka.
Also note that this is not for a blueprint, it's just related
to a blueprint that landed in mitaka but introduced a regression
here when support was added for that blueprint with the 2.25
microversion.

openstack%2Fnetworking-ovn~master~Ib5921fb7ba9efa0b5cf4cc8c99897473628dfae9,openstack/networking-ovn,master,splitdb_northd,Ib5921fb7ba9efa0b5cf4cc8c99897473628dfae9,Start ovn-northd in the devstack screen as a foreground process,MERGED,2016-03-29 06:02:20.000000000,2016-03-30 06:51:08.000000000,2016-03-30 06:51:07.000000000,16,12,14,298538,478e705ced7ed2b0bd815397e170d8781a0643de,27,7,4,2,17595,Amitabha Biswas,azbiswas,Start ovn-northd in the devstack screen as a foreground process
A side-effect of separate ovsdb-server processors handling NB and SB
for default devstack (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/276364/) is
the use of ovn-ctl start_northd command to spawn the ovn-northd
process. The functionality of the devstack setup is correct, but in
the screen associated with the ovn-northd process, the output seen
is the following:
>> & echo $! >/opt/stack/status/stack/ovn-northd.pid; fg || \
echo ""ovn-northd failed to start"" | \
tee ""/opt/stack/status/stack/ovn-northd.failure""
bash: syntax error near unexpected token `&'
The ovn-northd process is actually spawned correctly and can be seen
in the output of ps. The start_northd creates ovn-northd as a daemon
and as a result the screen associated with ovn-northd doesn't have
a handle to the process.
This patch starts the ovn-northd as a foreground process in the
devstack screen. It also provides some simple command line options
associated with start_northd command in the documentation for a
non-devstack use case.
Change-Id: Ib5921fb7ba9efa0b5cf4cc8c99897473628dfae9

openstack%2Fkolla~master~Id047dbcd438edc748fbe928cabbdbc1060c7c3de,openstack/kolla,master,add_service_option,Id047dbcd438edc748fbe928cabbdbc1060c7c3de,Add optional services option in globals.yml,MERGED,2016-03-28 05:27:15.000000000,2016-03-30 06:39:17.000000000,2016-03-30 06:11:32.000000000,9,0,6,298104,e1b9b8e7f57b295a2af7ae69fdf400a6aa3dc416,25,10,3,1,18009,Md Nadeem,mail2nadeem92,Add optional services option in globals.yml

openstack%2Fkuryr~master~I570aa4e77c906d3f04768e882f02050cd0cad558,openstack/kuryr,master,bp/existing-neutron-network,I570aa4e77c906d3f04768e882f02050cd0cad558,Support for existing Neutron nets,MERGED,2016-03-28 19:21:57.000000000,2016-03-30 06:37:01.000000000,2016-03-30 06:37:01.000000000,288,61,10,298387,b25eca0d7dbbc63b6db7a3ed9fa471f247857e15,11,6,2,6,1923,Mohammad Banikazemi,mb-s,Support for existing Neutron nets
An existing Neutron network can be specified as the network
being used for a Docker network being created. The Neutron
network id or name can be specified.
If a Docker network is deleted, the corresponding pre existing
Neutron network will not be deleted.
Usage:
docker network create -d kuryr --ipam-driver=kuryr
-o neutron.net.uuid=d98d1259-03d1-4b45-9b86-b039cba1d90d mynet
docker network create -d kuryr --ipam-driver=kuryr
-o neutron.net.name=my_neutron_net mynet
If subnet being specified does not exist, it will be created by
Kuryr. If exists it will be used.
Blueprint existing-neutron-network
Change-Id: I570aa4e77c906d3f04768e882f02050cd0cad558

openstack%2Fneutron~master~Ib6b6f2fe76fe82253f195c9eab6b243d9eb76fa2,openstack/neutron,master,bug/1561046,Ib6b6f2fe76fe82253f195c9eab6b243d9eb76fa2,Remove obsolete keepalived PID files before start,MERGED,2016-03-23 15:20:34.000000000,2016-03-30 05:57:02.000000000,2016-03-30 00:28:05.000000000,73,3,11,296532,e98fabb5836b12bc40a2b64a2668893ea73c2320,44,17,3,2,19797,Hynek Mlnarik,hmlnarik,Remove obsolete keepalived PID files before start
keepalived refuses to start and claims ""daemon already started""
when there is already a process with the same PID as found in
either the VRRP or the main process PID file. This happens even
in case when the new process is not keepalived. The situation
can happen when the neutron node is reset and the obsolete PID
files are not cleaned before neutron is started.
This commit adds PID file cleanup before keepalived start.
Closes-Bug: 1561046
Change-Id: Ib6b6f2fe76fe82253f195c9eab6b243d9eb76fa2

openstack%2Fpython-ironicclient~master~I25a5d24e9c429bdd119abf9efb24e3cc822eef4a,openstack/python-ironicclient,master,,I25a5d24e9c429bdd119abf9efb24e3cc822eef4a,Fix pep8 stderr warning regarding __all__ defined as list,MERGED,2016-03-28 18:02:45.000000000,2016-03-30 04:14:42.000000000,2016-03-30 04:14:42.000000000,2,2,0,298355,059ebb72b0ed008cc841f242b6a87432eb35483d,10,4,1,1,14760,John L. Villalovos,jlvillal,Fix pep8 stderr warning regarding __all__ defined as list
During the pep8 run get the following warning generated:
./ironicclient/__init__.py WARNING: __all__ is defined as a list, this
means pep257 cannot reliably detect contents of the __all__ variable,
because it can be mutated. Change __all__ to be an (immutable) tuple, to
remove this warning. Note, pep257 uses __all__ to detect which
definitions are public, to warn if public definitions are missing
docstrings. If __all__ is a (mutable) list, pep257 cannot reliably
assume its contents. pep257 will proceed assuming __all__ is not
mutated.
Change-Id: I25a5d24e9c429bdd119abf9efb24e3cc822eef4a

openstack%2Fnova~master~I1dc5601027ac97158d409d799b314a0c49968ce5,openstack/nova,master,bp/sriov-pf-passthrough-neutron-port,I1dc5601027ac97158d409d799b314a0c49968ce5,Add a vnic type for PF passthrough and a new libvirt vif driver,MERGED,2015-12-30 18:54:52.000000000,2016-03-30 03:46:18.000000000,2016-03-29 20:56:40.000000000,43,11,16,262583,32069c8f397e395134c3b1142c2d852640685fef,290,24,23,5,5511,Nikola Dipanov,ndipanov,Add a vnic type for PF passthrough and a new libvirt vif driver

openstack%2Fastara-appliance~stable%2Fmitaka~Ibee73d7a43864da645b5d7198a5df2f2bf936ea9,openstack/astara-appliance,stable/mitaka,bug/1558577,Ibee73d7a43864da645b5d7198a5df2f2bf936ea9,Allow gunicorn workers 5 min. to process requests,MERGED,2016-03-30 01:01:12.000000000,2016-03-30 02:39:41.000000000,2016-03-30 02:39:41.000000000,1,1,0,299049,d499715dae5ce2f567c9c6d1923a4cf4b70f2793,6,2,1,1,1420,Adam Gandelman,gandelman-a,Allow gunicorn workers 5 min. to process requests
Config updates can be time consuming, especially in testing environments
that utilize virt-on-virt.  Rather than timing out workers that are taking
a long time to process an update, bump the timeout to 5 minutes and allow
the requesting orchestrator to time out its request at shorter deadlines
instead.
Change-Id: Ibee73d7a43864da645b5d7198a5df2f2bf936ea9
(cherry picked from commit 179d7237476803b56cd380ea8b5e12ae3b6a5aba)

openstack%2Fpython-novaclient~stable%2Fmitaka~I62fe2e00433fd216def25d99a2f20d17b988fb84,openstack/python-novaclient,stable/mitaka,fix-nmi,I62fe2e00433fd216def25d99a2f20d17b988fb84,Remove console expectation from NMI tests,MERGED,2016-03-30 00:05:29.000000000,2016-03-30 02:11:40.000000000,2016-03-30 02:11:40.000000000,0,13,0,299037,e5afdbb42ec044b1e7970f307e2a7d3830f7126d,9,5,1,1,6873,Matt Riedemann,mriedem,Remove console expectation from NMI tests
The original tests expect the server console contains a message
""Uhhuh. NMI received for unknown reason""
but the expectation is wrong because this message is fallback one
when disabling crash dump, that means the test expects the crash
dump is disable. That is not the purpose of this NMI feature.
In addition, this message is output on x86 cpu architecture only
because the message is implemented in
https://github.com/torvalds/linux/blob/master/arch/x86/kernel/nmi.c#L304
So if we use the other cpu architectures on the test, this test will
fail.
Let's remove the expectation from the tests.
Change-Id: I62fe2e00433fd216def25d99a2f20d17b988fb84
Closes-Bug: #1553597
(cherry picked from commit 471e08a4d41f9d1bcf4703b4a0c64731a94f2510)

openstack%2Fnova~master~I62a7ff16f1c9c5da923451520fbeeabb5cc0c5c6,openstack/nova,master,bug/1560860,I62a7ff16f1c9c5da923451520fbeeabb5cc0c5c6,Fix detach SR-IOV when using LibvirtConfigGuestHostdevPCI,MERGED,2016-03-23 09:17:32.000000000,2016-03-30 02:04:30.000000000,2016-03-29 18:11:27.000000000,27,24,17,296305,f15d9a9693b19393fcde84cf4bc6f044d39ffdca,61,20,2,2,12171,Moshe Levi,moshele,Fix detach SR-IOV when using LibvirtConfigGuestHostdevPCI
This patch fixes an issue which was introduced by this
change If3edc1965c01a077eb61984a442e0d778d870d75.
Usually the vif config is of type LibvirtConfigGuestInterface,
but some vif use LibvirtConfigGuestHostdevPCI config
(e.g.  the ib_hostdev). The difference is that
LibvirtConfigGuestInterface keeps the pci address in source_dev
while LibvirtConfigGuestHostdevPCI has domain, bus, slot and
function, instead of relying on the vif config type we can take the
pci address for the neutron port.
Closes-Bug: #1560860
Change-Id: I62a7ff16f1c9c5da923451520fbeeabb5cc0c5c6

openstack%2Fastara~master~I491b96c43d898f7a961725e4f5720af7b9547038,openstack/astara,master,bump_timeout,I491b96c43d898f7a961725e4f5720af7b9547038,devstack: Bump alive_timeout,MERGED,2016-03-29 19:30:23.000000000,2016-03-30 01:54:00.000000000,2016-03-30 01:54:00.000000000,2,3,0,298949,93261b2a1a6975c4c755a8a36be7d11c3a620181,9,3,2,2,1420,Adam Gandelman,gandelman-a,devstack: Bump alive_timeout

config update.

openstack%2Fneutron-lib~master~I89b247bdac3aee1e47ee8a1c9f1cb2c385019a51,openstack/neutron-lib,master,bug/1554519,I89b247bdac3aee1e47ee8a1c9f1cb2c385019a51,New device owner flag for HA router interface,MERGED,2016-03-11 10:13:17.000000000,2016-03-30 01:05:02.000000000,2016-03-30 01:05:02.000000000,4,0,4,291641,0440878cc61737cf68a2f5780fc8af57845078fd,31,11,4,1,10267,venkata anil,anil,New device owner flag for HA router interface
Currently HA router interface port uses DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF as
device owner(like normal router interface). So to check if a port is
a HA router interface port, we have to perform a DB operation.
Neutron server at many places may need check if a port is HA router
interface port and perform different set of operations, then it has
to access DB for this. Instead of that, if this information is
available as port's device owner, we can avoid DB access every time.
Partial-Bug: #1554519
Change-Id: I89b247bdac3aee1e47ee8a1c9f1cb2c385019a51

openstack%2Fastara~stable%2Fmitaka~I491b96c43d898f7a961725e4f5720af7b9547038,openstack/astara,stable/mitaka,298864,I491b96c43d898f7a961725e4f5720af7b9547038,Fix bugs in functional tests,MERGED,2016-03-29 22:08:47.000000000,2016-03-30 00:48:31.000000000,2016-03-30 00:48:31.000000000,12,12,0,299004,466480bad770bb5a6cfe74d6f98abc95cac1c65e,6,2,1,3,1420,Adam Gandelman,gandelman-a,Fix bugs in functional tests
Pulls in some fixes from master that address new issues that recently
started affecting our gate jobs.
Includes:
Fix bugs in functional tests
- Dont cache management address of appliances
- Wait for nova instance status==active before asserting router status
- Wait a full config_timeout (600s) for rebuild
- Also look for ha router interfaces when cleaning up
Change-Id: I69341c6abee4e36b10f8e9b676587babe861f0c0
And:
devstack: Bump alive_timeout
Bump alive timeout to 60s to deal with slow qemu instances.
Also, give astara more time to recover from a degraded cluster. This
can be slow to recover when a slow qemu node is waiting on a long-running
config update.

openstack%2Fironic-python-agent~master~I8cf5ce5bd5345ccea5e8869f2628f8616d0fe758,openstack/ironic-python-agent,master,bug/1559383,I8cf5ce5bd5345ccea5e8869f2628f8616d0fe758,Fix full_trusty_build once and for all,MERGED,2016-03-29 20:08:23.000000000,2016-03-30 00:40:13.000000000,2016-03-30 00:40:13.000000000,7,7,0,298962,473b6b4661480e0a2e2c363553e48d62c7145272,12,4,1,1,10343,Jim Rollenhagen,jimrollenhagen,Fix full_trusty_build once and for all

'cgroup-lite' package is what we were missing, not lxc.

openstack%2Fswift~master~I0e2bbdd99add86ee46e856920c0740c4aa13c77d,openstack/swift,master,bug/1549615,I0e2bbdd99add86ee46e856920c0740c4aa13c77d,Fix account-reaper unable to delete all containers.,MERGED,2016-02-25 07:32:47.000000000,2016-03-30 00:39:23.000000000,2016-03-30 00:39:21.000000000,85,16,2,284562,6b4e73bb15c680ada8b30279b090c6123ce5731f,32,7,5,2,12050,Charles Hsu,charz,Fix account-reaper unable to delete all containers.
When reaper try to find the correct container_shard number,
but it doesn't compare local device's name, so it always
return first entry's index of local devices from the ring
to container_shard.
That causes some containers will be skip and objects under
these containers won't be delete.
Change-Id: I0e2bbdd99add86ee46e856920c0740c4aa13c77d
Closes-Bug: #1549615

openstack%2Frequirements~stable%2Fliberty~Ie77a9622d16bd02b3607fc1c9f8da20dc1ffb856,openstack/requirements,stable/liberty,bug/1543958,Ie77a9622d16bd02b3607fc1c9f8da20dc1ffb856,Change global requirements to exclude cliff version 1.16.0 and 1.17.0,MERGED,2016-03-07 18:11:39.000000000,2016-03-30 00:38:55.000000000,2016-03-30 00:38:55.000000000,1,1,10,289496,e7dd2aab268cda23b03af9c39fded29f199c4039,29,11,4,1,1916,Guang Yee,guang-yee,Change global requirements to exclude cliff version 1.16.0 and 1.17.0
1.16.0 uses fcntl which is not available on windows (See Bug #1543958).
1.17.0 does not work when an empty list is provided (See Bug #1539770).
There are no further releases in the 1.x series after 1.17.0 and the both
issues were addressed as of 2.0.0 so we should be fine with the
exclusion.
Conflicts:
Related-Bug: 1543958
Related-Bug: 1539770
Change-Id: Ie77a9622d16bd02b3607fc1c9f8da20dc1ffb856
(cherry picked from commit 0ad86c4d711e4145ad3a37951949ee30bf2c7b81)

openstack%2Fkeystone~master~Ic689fcb003b801db5b5afc64e7dd249f2f5c3dde,openstack/keystone,master,opportunistic_testing,Ic689fcb003b801db5b5afc64e7dd249f2f5c3dde,Opportunistic testing with different DBs,MERGED,2016-03-22 13:52:37.000000000,2016-03-30 00:10:07.000000000,2016-03-30 00:10:07.000000000,11,1,1,295837,5f4554154eff93167c5ce1ad9b7f60b3eccf3790,23,7,8,2,6486,Brant Knudson,blk-u,Opportunistic testing with different DBs
If there is a MySql or Postgresql database available that oslo.db
can connect to, run the migration tests using these databases.
OpenStack infra makes MySql and Postgresql databases available.
This will improve test coverage and ensure that the migrations
work on production databases.
Change-Id: Ic689fcb003b801db5b5afc64e7dd249f2f5c3dde

openstack%2Fkeystone~master~I3e05e132139623c6323338c3ba5a0742542e7562,openstack/keystone,master,opportunistic_testing,I3e05e132139623c6323338c3ba5a0742542e7562,Correct test_implied_roles_fk_on_delete_cascade,MERGED,2016-03-22 19:29:19.000000000,2016-03-30 00:09:58.000000000,2016-03-30 00:09:57.000000000,35,8,0,296018,3bf13c1057278863b33ba27729973549a5b5be09,18,5,6,1,6486,Brant Knudson,blk-u,Correct test_implied_roles_fk_on_delete_cascade
This test was using the role_api to insert rows into and query the
database. The rows inserted into the database for migration tests
must be inserted directly because the driver is not necessarily
going to work with the old version of the database that's in use in
the test and the contents of the database could change and not match
what the old version of the code actually inserted.
